controls.title: Security & Privacy Governance Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity and privacy governance controls.

controls.title: Publishing Security & Privacy Documentation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish, maintain and disseminate cybersecurity and privacy policies, standards and procedures.

controls.title: Periodic Review & Update of Security & Privacy Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to review the cybersecurity and privacy program, including policies, standards and procedures, at planned intervals or if significant changes occur to ensure their continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness.

controls.title: Assigned Security & Privacy Responsibilities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to assign a qualified individual with the mission and resources to centrally-manage, coordinate, develop, implement and maintain an enterprise-wide cybersecurity and privacy program.

controls.title: Measures of Performance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor cybersecurity and privacy program measures of performance.

controls.title: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to assist organizational management in performance monitoring and trend analysis of the cybersecurity and privacy program.

controls.title: Key Risk Indicators (KRIs)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop, report and monitor Key Risk Indicators (KRIs) to assist senior management in performance monitoring and trend analysis of the cybersecurity and privacy program.

controls.title: Contacts With Authorities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and document appropriate contacts within relevant law enforcement and regulatory bodies.

controls.title: Contacts With Groups & Associations
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to establish contact with selected groups and associations within the cybersecurity & privacy communities to: 
 ▪ Facilitate ongoing cybersecurity and privacy education and training for organizational personnel;
 ▪ Maintain currency with recommended cybersecurity and privacy practices, techniques and technologies; and
 ▪ Share current security-related information including threats, vulnerabilities and incidents.

controls.title: Defining Business Context & Mission
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define the context of its business model and document the mission of the organization.

controls.title: Define Control Objectives
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish control objectives as the basis for the selection, implementation and management of the organization’s internal control system.

controls.title: Asset Governance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate an IT Asset Management (ITAM) program to implement and manage asset management controls.

controls.title: Asset-Service Dependencies
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and assess the security of technology assets that support more than one critical business function.

controls.title: Stakeholder Identification & involvement
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and involve pertinent stakeholders of critical systems, applications and services to support the ongoing secure management of those assets.

controls.title: Asset Inventories
Updates During Installations / Removals
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to update asset inventories as part of component installations, removals and asset upgrades.

controls.title: Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to detect and respond to the presence of unauthorized hardware, software and firmware components.

controls.title: Component Duplication Avoidance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish and maintain an authoritative source and repository to provide a trusted source and accountability for approved and implemented system components that prevents assets from being duplicated in other asset inventories

controls.title: Approved Deviations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to track instances of approved deviations from the standardized baseline configuration.

controls.title: Network Access Control (NAC)
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to employ Network Access Control (NAC) that is capable of detecting unauthorized devices and disable network access to those unauthorized devices.

controls.title: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) Server Logging
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enable Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server logging to improve asset inventories and assist in detecting unknown systems.

controls.title: Software Licensing Restrictions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure compliance with software licensing restrictions.

controls.title: Data Action Mapping
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to create and maintain a map of systems of where sensitive data is stored, transmitted or processed.

controls.title: Configuration Management Database (CMDB)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement and manage a Configuration Management Database (CMDB), or similar technology, to collect and manage asset-specific information.

controls.title: Assigning Ownership of Assets
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to assign asset ownership responsibilities to a department, team or individual that establishes a common understanding of controls to protect assets.

controls.title: Accountability Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to include capturing the name, position and/or role of individuals responsible/accountable for administering assets as part of the asset inventory process.

controls.title: Network Diagrams & Data Flow Diagrams (DFDs)
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to maintain network architecture diagrams that: 
 ▪ Contain sufficient detail to assess the security of the network's architecture;
 ▪ Reflect the current state of the network environment; and
 ▪ Document all sensitive data flows.

controls.title: Security of Assets & Media
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain strict control over the internal or external distribution of any kind of sensitive media.

controls.title: Unattended End-User Equipment
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement enhanced protection measures for unattended systems to protect against tampering and unauthorized access.

controls.title: Asset Storage In Automobiles
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to educate users on the need to physically secure laptops and other mobile devices out of site when traveling, preferably in the trunk of a vehicle.

controls.title: Kiosks & Point of Sale (PoS) Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect devices that capture sensitive data via direct physical interaction from tampering and substitution.

controls.title: Tamper Detection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to inspect mobile devices for evidence of tampering upon return from geographic regions of concern or other known hostile environments that could lead to device compromise.

controls.title: Secure Disposal or Re-Use of Equipment
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to securely destroy media when it is no longer needed for business or legal reasons.

controls.title: Return of Assets
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that employees and third-party users return all organizational assets in their possession upon termination of employment, contract or agreement.

controls.title: Removal of Assets
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to authorize, control and track systems entering and exiting organizational facilities.

controls.title: Use of Personal Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the possession and usage of personally-owned technology devices within organization-controlled facilities.

controls.title: Use of Third-Party Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to reduce the risk associated with third-party assets that are attached to the network from harming organizational assets or exfiltrating organizational data.

controls.title: Usage Parameters
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce and monitor usage parameters that limit the potential damage caused from the unauthorized alteration of system parameters.

controls.title: Tamper Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to validate the integrity of configuration settings of critical systems, system components or services throughout all phases of the Secure Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

controls.title: Inspection of Systems, Components & Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to physically and logically inspect critical systems to detect evidence of tampering.

controls.title: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Usage
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement and govern a Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) program to reduce risk associated with personally-owned devices in the workplace.

controls.title: Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of contingency planning controls to help ensure resilient assets and services.

controls.title: Coordinate with Related Plans
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to coordinate contingency plan development with internal and external elements responsible for related plans.

controls.title: Coordinate With External Service Providers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to coordinate internal contingency plans with the contingency plans of external service providers to ensure that contingency controls can be satisfied.

controls.title: Transfer to Alternate Processing / Storage Site
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to redeploy personnel to other roles during a disruptive event or in the execution of a continuity plan.

controls.title: Recovery Time / Point Objectives (RTO / RPO)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure the alternate storage site to facilitate recovery operations in accordance with Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs).

controls.title: Identify Critical Assets
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and document the critical systems, applications and services that support essential missions and business functions.

controls.title: Resume All Missions & Business Functions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to resume all missions and business functions within Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) of the contingency plan's activation.

controls.title: Continue Essential Mission & Business Functions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to continue essential missions and business functions with little or no loss of operational continuity and sustain that continuity until full system restoration at primary processing and/or storage sites.

controls.title: Resume Essential Missions & Business Functions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to resume essential missions and business functions within an organization-defined time period of contingency plan activation.

controls.title: Contingency Training
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to train applicable contingency personnel in their contingency roles and responsibilities.

controls.title: Simulated Events
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to incorporate simulated events into contingency training to facilitate effective response by personnel in crisis situations.

controls.title: Automated Training Environments
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to provide a more thorough and realistic contingency training environment.

controls.title: Contingency Plan Testing & Exercises
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct tests and/or exercises to determine the contingency plan's effectiveness and the organization’s readiness to execute the plan.

controls.title: Coordinated Testing with Related Plans
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to coordinate contingency plan testing with internal and external elements responsible for related plans.

controls.title: Alternate Storage & Processing Sites
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to test the contingency plan at the alternate processing site to both familiarize contingency personnel with the facility and evaluate the capabilities of the alternate processing site to support contingency operations.

controls.title: Contingency Plan Root Cause Analysis (RCA) & Lessons Learned
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct a Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and "lessons learned" activity every time the contingency plan is activated.

controls.title: Contingency Planning & Updates
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to keep contingency plans current with business needs and technology changes.

controls.title: Alternative Security Measures
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement alternative or compensating controls to satisfy security functions when the primary means of implementing the security function is unavailable or compromised.

controls.title: Alternate Storage Site
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish an alternate storage site that includes both the assets and necessary agreements to permit the storage and recovery of system backup information.

controls.title: Separation from Primary Site
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to separate the alternate storage site from the primary storage site to reduce susceptibility to similar threats.

controls.title: Accessibility
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and mitigate potential accessibility problems to the alternate storage site in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster.

controls.title: Alternate Processing Site
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish an alternate processing site that provides security measures equivalent to that of the primary site.

controls.title: Separation from Primary Site
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to separate the alternate processing site from the primary processing site to reduce susceptibility to similar threats.

controls.title: Accessibility
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify potential accessibility problems to the alternate processing site and possible mitigation actions, in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster.

controls.title: Priority of Service
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address priority-of-service provisions in alternate processing and storage sites that support availability controls, including Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs).

controls.title: Preparation for Use
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prepare the alternate processing site so that the site is ready to be used as the operational site; capable of supporting essential missions and business functions.

controls.title: Inability to Return to Primary Site
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to plan and prepare for both natural and manmade circumstances that preclude returning to the primary processing site.

controls.title: Telecommunications Services Availability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to reduce the likelihood of a single point of failure with primary telecommunications services.

controls.title: Priority of Service Provisions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to formalize primary and alternate telecommunications service agreements to contain priority-of-service provisions that support availability controls, including Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs).

controls.title: Separation of Primary / Alternate Providers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to obtain alternate telecommunications services from providers that are separated from primary service providers to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

controls.title: Provider Continency Plan
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to contractually-require telecommunications service providers to have contingency plans that meet organizational contingency controls.

controls.title: Data Backups
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to create recurring backups of data, software and system images to ensure the availability of the data.

controls.title: Testing for Reliability & Integrity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to routinely test backups that verifies the reliability of the backup process, as well as the integrity and availability of the data.

controls.title: Separate Storage for Critical Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to store backup copies of critical software and other security-related information in a separate facility or in a fire-rated container that is not collocated with the system being backed up.

controls.title: Information System Imaging
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to reimage assets from configuration-controlled and integrity-protected images that represent a secure, operational state.

controls.title: Cryptographic Protection
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to prevent the unauthorized disclosure and modification of backup information.

controls.title: Test Restoration Using Sampling
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize sampling of available backups to test recovery capabilities as part of contingency plan testing.

controls.title: Transfer to Alternate Storage Site
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to transfer information system backup data to the alternate storage site at a rate that is capable of meeting Recovery Time Objectives (RTOs) and Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs).

controls.title: Redundant Secondary System
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain a failover system that is not collocated with the primary system and that can be activated without loss of information or disruption to operations.

controls.title: Dual Authorization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement and enforce dual authorization for the deletion or destruction of sensitive backup media and data.

controls.title: Information System Recovery & Reconstitution
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure the recovery and reconstitution of systems to a known state after a disruption, compromise or failure.

controls.title: Transaction Recovery
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize specialized backup mechanisms that will allow transaction recovery for transaction-based applications and services in accordance with Recovery Point Objectives (RPOs).

controls.title: Failover Capability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement real-time or near-real-time failover capability to maintain availability of critical systems.

controls.title: Electronic Discovery (eDiscovery)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize electronic discovery (eDiscovery) that covers current and archived communication transactions.

controls.title: Restore Within Time Period
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restore information system components within organization-defined restoration time-periods from configuration-controlled and integrity-protected information; representing a known, operational state for the components.

controls.title: Backup & Restoration Hardware Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect backup and restoration hardware and software.

controls.title: Capacity & Performance Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of capacity management controls to ensure optimal system performance for future capacity controls.

controls.title: Resource Priority
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control resource utilization of systems that are susceptible to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks to limit and prioritize the use of resources.

controls.title: Capacity Planning
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conducted capacity planning so that necessary capacity for information processing, telecommunications and environmental support will exist during contingency operations.

controls.title: Change Management Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of change management controls.

controls.title: Configuration Change Control
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern the technical configuration change control processes.

controls.title: Prohibition Of Changes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit unauthorized changes, unless designated approvals are received.

controls.title: Test, Validate & Document Changes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to test and document proposed changes in a non-production environment before changes are implemented in a production environment.

controls.title: Security Representative for Change
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to include a cybersecurity representative in the configuration change control review process.

controls.title: Automated Security Response
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to implement remediation actions upon the detection of unauthorized baseline configurations change(s).

controls.title: Cryptographic Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern assets involved in providing cryptographic protections according to the organization's configuration management processes.

controls.title: Security Impact Analysis for Changes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to analyze proposed changes for potential security impacts, prior to the implementation of the change.

controls.title: Access Restriction For Change
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce configuration restrictions in an effort to restrict the ability of users to conduct unauthorized changes.

controls.title: Automated Access Enforcement / Auditing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform after-the-fact reviews of configuration change logs to discover any unauthorized changes.

controls.title: Signed Components
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent the installation of software and firmware components without verification that the component has been digitally signed using a certificate that is recognized and approved by the organization.

controls.title: Dual Authorization for Change
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce a two-person rule for implementing changes to critical assets.

controls.title: Limit Production / Operational Privileges (Incompatible Roles)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit operational privileges for implementing changes.

controls.title: Library Privileges
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict software library privileges to those individuals with a pertinent business need for access.

controls.title: Stakeholder Notification of Changes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure stakeholders are made aware of and understand the impact of proposed changes.

controls.title: Security Functionality Verification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to verify the functionality of security controls when anomalies are discovered.

controls.title: Report Verification Results
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to report the results of security and privacy function verification to senior management.

controls.title: Cloud Services
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cloud management controls to ensure cloud instances are secure and in-line with industry practices.

controls.title: Cloud Security Architecture
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure the cloud security architecture supports the organization's technology strategy to securely design, configure and maintain cloud employments.

controls.title: Security Management Subnet
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to host security-specific technologies in a dedicated subnet.

controls.title: Application & Program Interface (API) Security
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure support for secure interoperability between components.

controls.title: Virtual Machine Images
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure the integrity of virtual machine images at all times.

controls.title: Multi-Tenant Environments
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure multi-tenant owned or managed assets (physical and virtual) are designed and governed such that provider and customer (tenant) user access is appropriately segmented from other tenant users.

controls.title: Data Handling & Portability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure cloud providers use secure protocols for the import, export and management of data in cloud-based services.

controls.title: Standardized Virtualization Formats
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure interoperability by requiring cloud providers to use industry-recognized formats and provide documentation of custom changes for review.

controls.title: Geolocation controls for Processing, Storage and Service Locations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control the location of cloud processing/storage based on business controls, as well as statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.title: Sensitive Data In Public Cloud Providers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit and manage the storage of sensitive data in public cloud providers.

controls.title: Cloud Access Point (CAP)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize Cloud Access Points (CAPs) to provide boundary protection and monitoring functions that both provide access to the cloud and protect the organization from the cloud.

controls.title: Statutory, Regulatory & Contractual Compliance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the identification and implementation of relevant legislative statutory, regulatory and contractual controls.

controls.title: Security Controls Oversight
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide a security controls oversight function.

controls.title: Internal Audit Function
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement an internal audit function that is capable of providing senior organization management with insights into the appropriateness of the organization's technology and information governance processes.

controls.title: Security Assessments
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure managers regularly review the processes and documented procedures within their area of responsibility to adhere to appropriate security policies, standards and other applicable controls.

controls.title: Independent Assessors
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize independent assessors at planned intervals or when the system, service or project undergoes significant changes.

controls.title: Functional Review Of Security Controls
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to regularly review assets for compliance with the organization’s cybersecurity and privacy policies and standards.

controls.title: Audit Activities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to plan audits that minimize the impact of audit activities on business operations.

controls.title: Configuration Management Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of configuration management controls.

controls.title: Assignment of Responsibility
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement a segregation of duties for configuration management that prevents developers from performing production configuration management duties.

controls.title: System Hardening Through Baseline Configurations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop, document and maintain secure baseline configurations for technology platform that are consistent with industry-accepted system hardening standards.

controls.title: Reviews & Updates
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to review and update baseline configurations:
 ▪ At least annually;
 ▪ When required due to so; or
 ▪ As part of system component installations and upgrades.

controls.title: Automated Central Management & Verification
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to govern and report on baseline configurations of the systems.

controls.title: Retention Of Previous Configurations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to retain previous versions of baseline configuration to support roll back.

controls.title: Development & Test Environment Configurations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to manage baseline configurations for development and test environments separately from operational baseline configurations to minimize the risk of accidental changes.

controls.title: Configure Systems, Components or Services for High-Risk Areas
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure systems utilized in high-risk areas with more restrictive baseline configurations.

controls.title: Network Device Configuration File Synchronization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure network devices to synchronize startup and running configuration files.

controls.title: Approved Deviations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to document and manage approved deviations to standardized configurations.

controls.title: Respond To Unauthorized Changes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to respond to unauthorized changes to configuration settings as security incidents.

controls.title: Baseline Tailoring
Least Functionality
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure systems to provide only essential capabilities by specifically prohibiting or restricting the use of ports, protocols, and/or services.

controls.title: Periodic Review
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to periodically review system configurations to identify and disable unnecessary and/or non-secure functions, ports, protocols and services.

controls.title: Prevent Program Execution
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to prevent the execution of unauthorized software programs.

controls.title: Unauthorized or Authorized Software (Blacklisting or Whitelisting)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to whitelist or blacklist applications in an order to limit what is authorized to execute on systems.

controls.title: Split Tunneling
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent systems from creating split tunneling connections or similar techniques that could be used to exfiltrate data.

controls.title: Software Usage Restrictions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce software usage restrictions to comply with applicable contract agreements and copyright laws.

controls.title: Open Source Software
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish parameters for the secure use of open source software.

controls.title: Unsupported Internet Browsers & Email Clients
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to allow only approved Internet browsers and email clients to run on systems.

controls.title: User-Installed Software
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the ability of non-privileged users to install unauthorized software.

controls.title: Unauthorized Installation Alerts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure systems to generate an alert when the unauthorized installation of software is detected.

controls.title: Prohibit Installation Without Privileged Status
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the installation of software, unless the action is performed by a privileged user or service.

controls.title: Continuous Monitoring
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of enterprise-wide monitoring controls.

controls.title: Intrusion Detection & Prevention Systems (IDS & IPS)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (IDS / IPS) technologies on critical systems, key network segments and network choke points.

controls.title: Automated Tools for Real-Time Analysis
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool, to support near real-time analysis and the escalation of events.

controls.title: Inbound & Outbound Communications Traffic
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to continuously monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic for unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.

controls.title: System Generated Alerts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor, correlate and respond to alerts from physical, cybersecurity, privacy and supply chain activities to achieve integrated situational awareness.

controls.title: Wireless Intrusion Detection System (WIDS)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize Wireless Intrusion Detection / Protection Systems (WIDS / WIPS) to identify rogue wireless devices and to detect attack attempts via wireless networks.

controls.title: Host-Based Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize Host-based Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (HIDS/HIPS) to actively alert on or block unwanted activities and send logs to a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM), or similar automated tool, to maintain situational awareness.

controls.title: File Integrity Monitoring (FIM)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a File Integrity Monitor (FIM) or similar change-detection technology on critical assets to generate alerts for unauthorized modifications.

controls.title: Reviews & Updates
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to review event logs on an ongoing basis and escalate incidents in accordance with established timelines and procedures.

controls.title: Proxy Logging
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to log all Internet-bound requests, in order to identify prohibited activities and assist incident handlers with identifying potentially compromised systems.

controls.title: Deactivated Account Activity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor deactivated accounts for attempted usage.

controls.title: Automated Response to Suspicious Events
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to alert incident response personnel of detected suspicious events and implement actions to terminate suspicious events.

controls.title: Automated Alerts
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to alert incident response personnel of inappropriate or unusual activities that have security incident implications.

controls.title: Analyze Traffic / Event Patterns
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to "tune" event monitoring technologies through analyzing communications traffic/event patterns and developing profiles representing common traffic patterns and/or events.

controls.title: Individuals Posing Greater Risk
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement enhanced activity monitoring for individuals who have been identified as posing an increased level of risk.

controls.title: Privileged User Oversight
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement enhanced activity monitoring for privileged users.

controls.title: Analyze and Prioritize Monitoring controls
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to assess the organization's needs for monitoring and prioritize the monitoring of assets, based on asset criticality and the sensitivity of the data it stores, transmits and processes.

controls.title: Centralized Collection of Security Event Logs
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool, to support the centralized collection of security-related event logs.

controls.title: Correlate Monitoring Information
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to correlate logs from across the enterprise by a Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool, to maintain situational awareness.

controls.title: Central Review & Analysis
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to centrally collect, review and analyze audit records from multiple sources.

controls.title: Integration of Scanning & Other Monitoring Information
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to integrate the analysis of audit records with analysis of vulnerability scanners, network performance, system monitoring and other sources to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity.

controls.title: Correlation with Physical Monitoring
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to correlate information from audit records with information obtained from monitoring physical access to further enhance the ability to identify suspicious, inappropriate, unusual or malevolent activity.

controls.title: Permitted Actions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to specify the permitted actions for both users and systems associated with the review, analysis and reporting of audit information.

controls.title: Audit Level Adjustments
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to adjust the level of audit review, analysis and reporting based on evolving threat information from law enforcement, industry associations or other credible sources of threat intelligence.

controls.title: System-Wide / Time-Correlated Audit Trail
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to compile audit records into an organization-wide audit trail that is time-correlated.

controls.title: Changes by Authorized Individuals
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide privileged users or roles the capability to change the auditing to be performed on specified information system components based on specific event criteria within specified time thresholds.

controls.title: Content of Audit Records
Sensitive Audit Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect sensitive data contained in log files.

controls.title: Audit Trails
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to link system access to individual users or service accounts.

controls.title: Privileged Functions Logging
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to log and review the actions of users and/or services with elevated privileges.

controls.title: Verbosity Logging for Boundary Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to verbosely log all traffic (both allowed and blocked) arriving at network boundary devices, including firewalls, Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS) and inbound and outbound proxies.

controls.title: Limit Personal Data (PD) In Audit Records
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit Personal Data (PD) contained in audit records to the elements identified in the privacy risk assessment.

controls.title: Centralized Management of Planned Audit Record Content
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to centrally manage and configure the content required to be captured in audit records generated by organization-defined information system components.

controls.title: Audit Storage Capacity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to allocate and proactively manage sufficient audit record storage capacity to reduce the likelihood of such capacity being exceeded.

controls.title: Response To Audit Processing Failures
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to alert appropriate personnel in the event of a log processing failure and take actions to remedy the incident.

controls.title: Real-Time Alerts of Audit Failure
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide 24x7x365 near real-time alerting capability when a log processing failure occurs.

controls.title: Audit Storage Capacity Alerting
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to alert appropriate personnel or roles when the allocated volume reaches an organization-defined percentage of maximum audit record storage capacity.

controls.title: Monitoring Reporting
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide an event log report generation capability to aid in detecting and assessing anomalous activities.

controls.title: Query Parameter Audits of Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide and implement the capability for auditing the parameters of user query events for data sets containing Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Trend Analysis Reporting
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to employ trend analyses to determine if security control implementations, the frequency of continuous monitoring activities, and/or the types of activities used in the continuous monitoring process need to be modified based on empirical data.

controls.title: Time Stamps
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure systems to use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records.

controls.title: Synchronization With Authoritative Time Source
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to synchronize internal system clocks with an authoritative time source.

controls.title: Protection of Audit Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect event logs and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification and deletion.

controls.title: Audit Backup on Separate Physical Systems / Components
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to back up audit records onto a physically different system or system component than the Security Incident Event Manager (SIEM) or similar automated tool.

controls.title: Access by Subset of Privileged Users
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict access to the management of event logs to privileged users with a specific business need.

controls.title: Cryptographic Protection of Audit Information
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of audit information and audit tools.

controls.title: Dual Authorization
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for the movement or deletion of audit information.

controls.title: Non-Repudiation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a non-repudiation capability to protect against an individual falsely denying having performed a particular action.

controls.title: Audit Record Retention
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to retain audit records for a time period consistent with records retention controls to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet statutory, regulatory and contractual retention controls.

controls.title: Monitoring For Information Disclosure
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor for evidence of unauthorized exfiltration or disclosure of non-public information.

controls.title: Analyze Traffic for Covert Exfiltration
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to analyze network traffic to detect covert data exfiltration.

controls.title: Unauthorized Network Services
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to detect unauthorized network services and alert incident response personnel.

controls.title: Monitoring for Indicators of Compromise (IOC)
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to identify and alert on Indicators of Compromise (IoC).

controls.title: Session Audit
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to provide session audit capabilities that: 
 ▪ Capture and log all content related to a user session; and
 ▪ Remotely view all content related to an established user session in real time.

controls.title: Alternate Audit Capability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide an alternate audit capability in the event of a failure in primary audit capability.

controls.title: Cross-Organizational Monitoring
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to coordinate sanitized audit information among external organizations to identify anomalous events when audit information is shared across organizational boundaries, without giving away sensitive or critical business data.

controls.title: Sharing of Audit Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to share audit information with third-party organizations based on specific cross-organizational sharing agreements.

controls.title: Covert Channel Analysis
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct covert channel analysis to identify aspects of communications that are potential avenues for covert channels.

controls.title: Anomalous Behavior
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to detect and respond to anomalous behavior that could indicate account compromise or other malicious activities.

controls.title: Insider Threats
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor internal personnel activity for potential security incidents.

controls.title: Third-Party Threats
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor third-party personnel activity for potential security incidents.

controls.title: Unauthorized Activities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor for unauthorized activities, accounts, connections, devices and software.

controls.title: Use of Cryptographic Controls
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cryptographic protections controls using known public standards and trusted cryptographic technologies.

controls.title: Alternate Physical Protection
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information as an alternate to physical safeguards.

controls.title: Export-Controlled Technology
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address the exporting of cryptographic technologies in compliance with relevant statutory and regulatory controls.

controls.title: Pre/Post Transmission Handling
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of information during preparation for transmission and during reception.

controls.title: Conceal / Randomize Communications
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to conceal or randomize communication patterns.

controls.title: Cryptographic Module Authentication
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to enable systems to authenticate to a cryptographic module.

controls.title: Transmission Confidentiality
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality of data being transmitted.

controls.title: Transmission Integrity
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of data being transmitted.

controls.title: Encrypting Data At Rest
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized disclosure of information at rest.

controls.title: Storage Media
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of the information being stored on storage media.

controls.title: Offline Storage
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to remove unused data from online storage and archive it off-line in a secure location until it can be disposed of according to data retention controls.

controls.title: Non-Console Administrative Access
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of non-console administrative access.

controls.title: Wireless Access Authentication & Encryption
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect wireless access via secure authentication and encryption.

controls.title: Public Key Infrastructure (PKI)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement an internal Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) infrastructure or obtain PKI services from a reputable PKI service provider.

controls.title: Availability
controls.summary: Resiliency mechanisms exist to ensure the availability of data in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys.

controls.title: Cryptographic Key Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate cryptographic key management controls to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of keys.

controls.title: Symmetric Keys
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the production and management of symmetric cryptographic keys using Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)-compliant key management technology and processes.

controls.title: Asymmetric Keys
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the production and management of asymmetric cryptographic keys using approved key management technology and processes that protect the user’s private key.

controls.title: Cryptographic Key Loss or Change
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure the availability of information in the event of the loss of cryptographic keys by individual users.

controls.title: Control & Distribution of Cryptographic Keys
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the secure distribution of symmetric and asymmetric cryptographic keys using industry recognized key management technology and processes.

controls.title: Assigned Owners
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure cryptographic keys are bound to individual identities.

controls.title: Transmission of Security & Privacy Attributes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure systems associate security attributes with information exchanged between systems.

controls.title: Data Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of data protection controls.

controls.title: Data Stewardship
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure data stewardship is assigned, documented and communicated.

controls.title: Data & Asset Classification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure data and assets are categorized in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual controls.

controls.title: Media Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control and restrict access to digital and non-digital media to authorized individuals.

controls.title: Disclosure of Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit the disclosure of data to authorized parties.

controls.title: Masking Displayed Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to apply data masking to sensitive information that is displayed or printed.

controls.title: Media Marking
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to mark media in accordance with data protection controls so that personnel are alerted to distribution limitations, handling caveats and applicable security controls.

controls.title: Automated Marking
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to mark media and system output to indicate the distribution limitations, handling controls and applicable security markings (if any) of the information to aide Data Loss Prevention (DLP) technologies.

controls.title: Security & Privacy Attributes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to bind security attributes to information as it is stored, transmitted and processed.

controls.title: Dynamic Attribute Association
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to dynamically associate security and privacy attributes with individuals and objects as information is created, combined, or transformed, in accordance with organization-defined cybersecurity and privacy policies.

controls.title: Attribute Value Changes By Authorized Individuals
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals) the capability to define or change the value of associated security and privacy attributes.

controls.title: Maintenance of Attribute Associations By System
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain the association and integrity of security and privacy attributes to individuals and objects.

controls.title: Association of Attributes By Authorized Individuals
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide the capability to associate security and privacy attributes with individuals and objects by authorized individuals (or processes acting on behalf of individuals).

controls.title: Attribute Displays for Output Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to display security and privacy attributes in human-readable form on each object that the system transmits to output devices to identify special dissemination, handling or distribution instructions using human-readable, standard naming conventions.

controls.title: Data Subject Attribute Associations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require personnel to associate and maintain the association of security and privacy attributes with individuals and objects in accordance with security and privacy policies.

controls.title: Consistent Attribute Interpretation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide a consistent interpretation of security and privacy attributes transmitted between distributed system components.

controls.title: Identity Association Techniques & Technologies
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to associate security and privacy attributes to information.

controls.title: Attribute Reassignment
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to re-classify data as required, due to changing business/technical controls.

controls.title: Attribute Configuration By Authorized Individuals
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide authorized individuals the capability to define or change the type and value of security and privacy attributes available for association with subjects and objects.

controls.title: Audit Changes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to audit changes to security and privacy attributes and respond to them in a timely manner.

controls.title: Media Storage
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to: 
 ▪ Physically control and securely store digital and non-digital media within controlled areas using organization-defined security measures; and
 ▪ Protect system media until the media are destroyed or sanitized using approved equipment, techniques and procedures.

controls.title: Physically Secure All Media
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to physically secure all media that contains sensitive information.

controls.title: Sensitive Data Inventories
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain inventory logs of all sensitive media and conduct sensitive media inventories at least annually.

controls.title: Periodic Scans for Sensitive Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to periodically scan unstructured data sources for sensitive data or data requiring special protection measures by statutory, regulatory or contractual obligations.

controls.title: Making Sensitive Data Unreadable In Storage
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure sensitive data is rendered human unreadable anywhere sensitive data is stored.

controls.title: Storing Authentication Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the storage of sensitive authentication data after authorization.

controls.title: Media Transportation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect and control digital and non-digital media during transport outside of controlled areas using appropriate security measures.

controls.title: Custodians
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify custodians throughout the transport of system media.

controls.title: Encrypting Data In Storage Media
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information stored on digital media during transport outside of controlled areas.

controls.title: Physical Media Disposal
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to securely dispose of media when it is no longer required, using formal procedures.

controls.title: Digital Media Sanitization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to sanitize media, both digital and non-digital, with the strength and integrity commensurate with the classification or sensitivity of the information prior to disposal, release out of organizational control or release for reuse.

controls.title: Media Sanitization Documentation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to track, document and verify media sanitization and disposal actions.

controls.title: Equipment Testing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to test sanitization equipment and procedures to verify that the intended result is achieved.

controls.title: Destruction of Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the destruction of Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Non-Destructive Techniques
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to apply nondestructive sanitization techniques to portable storage devices prior to first use.

controls.title: Dual Authorization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for the destruction, disposal or sanitization of digital media that contains sensitive data.

controls.title: Media Use
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of types of digital media on systems or system components.

controls.title: Limitations on Use
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the use and distribution of sensitive data.

controls.title: Prohibit Use Without Owner
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of portable storage devices in organizational information systems when such devices have no identifiable owner.

controls.title: Media Downgrading
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to downgrade system media commensurate with the security category and/or classification level of the information.

controls.title: Removable Media Security
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict removable media in accordance with data handling and acceptable usage parameters.

controls.title: Use of External Information Systems
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern how external parties, systems and services are used to securely store, process and transmit data.

controls.title: Limits of Authorized Use
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to prohibit external parties, systems and services from storing, processing and transmitting data unless authorized individuals first: 
 ▪ Verifying the implementation of required security controls; or
 ▪ Retaining a processing agreement with the entity hosting the external systems or service.

controls.title: Portable Storage Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict or prohibit the use of portable storage devices by users on external systems.

controls.title: Protecting Sensitive Data on External Systems
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that the controls for the protection of sensitive information processed, stored or transmitted on external systems, are implemented in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.title: Non-Organizationally Owned Systems / Components / Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of non-organizationally owned information systems, system components or devices to process, store or transmit organizational information.

controls.title: Information Sharing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a process to assist users in making information sharing decisions to ensure data is appropriately protected.

controls.title: Information Search & Retrieval
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure information systems implement data search and retrieval functions that properly enforce data protection / sharing restrictions.

controls.title: Publicly Accessible Content
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control publicly-accessible content.

controls.title: Data Mining Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect data storage objects against unauthorized data mining and data harvesting techniques.

controls.title: Ad-Hoc Transfers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to secure ad-hoc exchanges of large digital files with internal or external parties.

controls.title: Media & Data Retention
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to retain media and data in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.title: Limit Personal Data (PD) Elements In Testing, Training & Research
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit Personal Data (PD) being processed in the information lifecycle to elements identified in the Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA).

controls.title: Minimize Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to minimize the use of Personal Data (PD) for research, testing, or training, in accordance with the Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA).

controls.title: Temporary Files Containing Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform periodic checks of temporary files for the existence of Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Geographic Location of Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to inventory, document and maintain data flows for data that is resident (permanently or temporarily) within a service's geographically distributed applications (physical and virtual), infrastructure, systems components and/or shared with other third-parties.

controls.title: Archived Data Sets
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect archived data in accordance with applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual obligations.

controls.title: Information Disposal
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to securely dispose of, destroy or erase information.

controls.title: Data Quality Operations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to check for the accuracy, relevance, timeliness, impact, completeness and de-identification of information across the information lifecycle.

controls.title: Updating & Correcting Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize technical controls to correct Personal Data (PD) that is inaccurate or outdated, incorrectly determined regarding impact, or incorrectly de-identified.

controls.title: Data Tags
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize data tags to automate tracking of sensitive data across the information lifecycle.

controls.title: Personal Data (PD) Collection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to collect Personal Data (PD) directly from the individual.

controls.title: De-Identification (Anonymization)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to remove Personal Data (PD) from datasets.

controls.title: Collection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to de-identify the dataset upon collection by not collecting Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Archiving
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to refrain from archiving Personal Data (PD) elements if those elements in a dataset will not be needed after the dataset is archived.

controls.title: Release
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to remove Personal Data (PD) elements from a dataset prior to its release if those elements in the dataset do not need to be part of the data release.

controls.title: Removal, Masking, Encryption, Hashing or Replacement of Direct Identifiers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to remove, mask, encrypt, hash or replace direct identifiers in a dataset.

controls.title: Statistical Disclosure Control
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to manipulate numerical data, contingency tables and statistical findings so that no person or organization is identifiable in the results of the analysis.

controls.title: Differential Privacy
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent disclosure of Personal Data (PD) by adding non-deterministic noise to the results of mathematical operations before the results are reported.

controls.title: Validated Software
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform de-identification using validated algorithms and software to implement the algorithms.

controls.title: Motivated Intruder
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform a motivated intruder test on the de-identified dataset to determine if the identified data remains or if the de-identified data can be re-identified.

controls.title: Information Location
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and document the location of information and the specific system components on which the information resides.

controls.title: Automated Tools to Support Information Location
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to identify by data classification type to ensure adequate security and privacy controls are in place to protect organizational information and individual privacy.

controls.title: Transfer of Personal Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict and govern the transfer of data to third-countries or international organizations.

controls.title: Embedded Technology Security Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of embedded technology controls.

controls.title: Internet of Things (IOT)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to proactively manage the cybersecurity and privacy risks associated with Internet of Things (IoT).

controls.title: Operational Technology (OT)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to proactively manage the cybersecurity and privacy risks associated with Operational Technology (OT).

controls.title: Endpoint Security
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of endpoint security controls.

controls.title: Endpoint Protection Measures
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality, integrity, availability and safety of endpoint devices.

controls.title: Prohibit Installation Without Privileged Status
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit user installation of software without explicitly assigned privileged status.

controls.title: Unauthorized Installation Alerts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to alert personnel when an unauthorized installation of software is detected.

controls.title: Access Restriction for Change
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define, document, approve and enforce access restrictions associated with changes to systems.

controls.title: Malicious Code Protection (Anti-Malware)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize antimalware technologies to detect and eradicate malicious code.

controls.title: Automatic Updates
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to automatically update antimalware technologies, including signature definitions.

controls.title: Documented Protection Measures
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to document antimalware technologies.

controls.title: Centralized Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage antimalware technologies.

controls.title: Heuristic / Nonsignature-Based Detection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize heuristic / nonsignature-based antimalware detection capabilities.

controls.title: Malware Protection Mechanism Testing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to test antimalware technologies by introducing a known benign, non-spreading test case into the system and subsequently verifying that both detection of the test case and associated incident reporting occurs.

controls.title: Evolving Malware Threats
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform periodic evaluations evolving malware threats to assess systems that are generally not considered to be commonly affected by malicious software.

controls.title: Always On Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that anti-malware technologies are continuously running in real-time and cannot be disabled or altered by non-privileged users, unless specifically authorized by management on a case-by-case basis for a limited time period.

controls.title: Software Firewall
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a host-based firewall software on all laptop computers and other portable workstations capable of implementing a host-based firewall.

controls.title: File Integrity Monitoring (FIM)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize File Integrity Monitor (FIM) technology to detect and report unauthorized changes to system files and configurations.

controls.title: Integrity Checks
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to validate configurations through integrity checking of software and firmware.

controls.title: Integration of Detection & Response
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to detect and respond to unauthorized configuration changes as cybersecurity incidents.

controls.title: Automated Notifications of Integrity Violations
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to alert incident response personnel upon discovering discrepancies during integrity verification.

controls.title: Automated Response to Integrity Violations
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to implement remediation actions when integrity violations are discovered.

controls.title: Verify Boot Process
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to verify the integrity of the boot process of information systems.

controls.title: Protection of Boot Firmware
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to protect the integrity of boot firmware in information systems.

controls.title: Binary or Machine-Executable Code
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of binary or machine-executable code from sources with limited or no warranty and without access to source code.

controls.title: Host Intrusion Detection and Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize Host-based Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (HIDS / HIPS) on sensitive systems.

controls.title: Phishing & Spam Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize anti-phishing and spam protection technologies to detect and take action on unsolicited messages transported by electronic mail.

controls.title: Central Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage anti-phishing and spam protection technologies.

controls.title: Automatic Updates
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to automatically update anti-phishing and spam protection technologies when new releases are available in accordance with configuration and change management practices.

controls.title: Trusted Path
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish a trusted communications path between the user and the security functions of the operating system.

controls.title: Mobile Code
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address mobile code / operating system-independent applications.

controls.title: Thin Nodes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure thin nodes to have minimal functionality and information storage.

controls.title: Port & Input / Output (I/O) Device Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to physically disable or remove unnecessary connection ports or input/output devices from sensitive systems.

controls.title: Sensor Capability
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to configure embedded sensors on systems to: 
 ▪ Prohibit the remote activation of sensing capabilities; and
 ▪ Provide an explicit indication of sensor use to users.

controls.title: Authorized Use
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize organization-defined measures so that data or information collected by sensors is only used for authorized purposes.

controls.title: Notice of Collection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to notify individuals that Personal Data (PD) is collected by sensors.

controls.title: Collection Minimization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize sensors that are configured to minimize the collection of information about individuals.

controls.title: Collaborative Computing Devices
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to unplug or prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices with the following exceptions: 
 ▪ Networked whiteboards; 
 ▪ Video teleconference cameras; and 
 ▪ Teleconference microphones.

controls.title: Disabling / Removal In Secure Work Areas
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to disable or remove collaborative computing devices from critical information systems and secure work areas.

controls.title: Explicitly Indicate Current Participants
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to provide an explicit indication of current participants in online meetings and teleconferences.

controls.title: Hypervisor Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict access to hypervisor management functions or administrative consoles for systems hosting virtualized systems.

controls.title: Security Function Isolation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure system configurations isolate security functions from non-security functions.

controls.title: Host-Based Security Function Isolation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement underlying software separation mechanisms to facilitate security function isolation.

controls.title: Human Resources Security Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of personnel security controls.

controls.title: Position Categorization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to manage personnel security risk by assigning a risk designation to all positions and establishing screening criteria for individuals filling those positions.

controls.title: Users With Elevated Privileges
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that every user accessing a system that processes, stores, or transmits sensitive information is cleared and regularly trained to handle the information in question.

controls.title: Roles & Responsibilities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define cybersecurity responsibilities for all personnel.

controls.title: User Awareness
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to communicate with users about their roles and responsibilities to maintain a safe and secure working environment.

controls.title: Competency controls for Security-Related Positions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that all security-related positions are staffed by qualified individuals who have the necessary skill set.

controls.title: Personnel Screening
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to manage personnel security risk by screening individuals prior to authorizing access.

controls.title: Roles With Special Protection Measures
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that individuals accessing a system that stores, transmits or processes information requiring special protection satisfy organization-defined personnel screening criteria.

controls.title: Formal Indoctrination
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to verify that individuals accessing a system processing, storing, or transmitting sensitive information are formally indoctrinated for all the relevant types of information to which they have access on the system.

controls.title: Terms of Employment
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require all employees and contractors to apply security and privacy principles in their daily work.

controls.title: Rules of Behavior
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define acceptable and unacceptable rules of behavior for the use of technologies, including consequences for unacceptable behavior.

controls.title: Social Media & Social Networking Restrictions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define rules of behavior that contain explicit restrictions on the use of social media and networking sites, posting information on commercial websites and sharing account information.

controls.title: Use of Communications Technology
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish usage restrictions and implementation guidance for communications technologies based on the potential to cause damage to systems, if used maliciously.

controls.title: Use of Critical Technologies
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern usage policies for critical technologies.

controls.title: Use of Mobile Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to manage business risks associated with permitting mobile device access to organizational resources.

controls.title: Access Agreements
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require internal and third-party users to sign appropriate access agreements prior to being granted access.

controls.title: Confidentiality Agreements
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) or similar confidentiality agreements that reflect the needs to protect data and operational details, or both employees and third-parties.

controls.title: Post-Employment Obligations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to notify terminated individuals of applicable, legally-binding post-employment controls for the protection of sensitive organizational information.

controls.title: Personnel Sanctions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to sanction personnel failing to comply with established security policies, standards and procedures.

controls.title: Workplace Investigations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct employee misconduct investigations when there is reasonable assurance that a policy has been violated.

controls.title: Personnel Transfer
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to adjust logical and physical access authorizations to systems and facilities upon personnel reassignment or transfer, in a timely manner.

controls.title: Personnel Termination
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern the termination of individual employment.

controls.title: Asset Collection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to retrieve organization-owned assets upon termination of an individual's employment.

controls.title: High-Risk Terminations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to expedite the process of removing "high risk" individual’s access to systems and applications upon termination, as determined by management.

controls.title: Post-Employment controls
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern third-party personnel by notifying terminated individuals of applicable, legally binding post-employment controls for the protection of organizational information.

controls.title: Automated Employment Status Notifications
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to notify Identity and Access Management (IAM) personnel or roles upon termination of an individual employment or contract.

controls.title: Third-Party Personnel Security
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern third-party personnel by reviewing and monitoring third-party cybersecurity and privacy roles and responsibilities.

controls.title: Separation of Duties
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement and maintain Separation of Duties (SoD) to prevent potential malevolent activity without collusion.

controls.title: Incompatible Roles
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to avoid incompatible development-specific roles through limiting and reviewing developer privileges to change hardware, software and firmware components within a production/operational environment.

controls.title: Two-Person Rule
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce a two-person rule for implementing changes to sensitive systems.

controls.title: Identify Critical Skills & Gaps
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to evaluate the critical cybersecurity and privacy skills needed to support the organization’s mission and identify gaps that exist.

controls.title: Remediate Identified Skills Deficiencies
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to remediate critical skills deficiencies necessary to support the organization’s mission and business functions.

controls.title: Identify Vital Cybersecurity & Privacy Staff
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify vital cybersecurity & privacy staff.

controls.title: Establish Redundancy for Vital Cybersecurity & Privacy Staff
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish redundancy for vital cybersecurity & privacy staff.

controls.title: Perform Succession Planning
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform succession planning for vital cybersecurity & privacy roles.

controls.title: Identity & Access Management (IAM)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of identification and access management controls.

controls.title: Identification & Authentication for Organizational Users
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users and processes acting on behalf of organizational users.

controls.title: Group Authentication
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require individuals to be authenticated with an individual authenticator when a group authenticator is utilized.

controls.title: Network Access to Privileged Accounts - Replay Resistant
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to employ replay-resistant network access authentication.

controls.title: Acceptance of PIV Credentials
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to accept and electronically verify organizational Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials.

controls.title: Out-of-Band Authentication (OOBA)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement Out-of-Band Authentication (OOBA) under specific conditions.

controls.title: Identification & Authentication for Non-Organizational Users
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and authenticate third-party users and processes that provide services to the organization.

controls.title: Acceptance of PIV Credentials from Other Organizations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials from third-parties.

controls.title: Acceptance of Third-Party Credentials
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to accept Federal Identity, Credential and Access Management (FICAM)-approved third-party credentials.

controls.title: Use of FICAM-Issued Profiles
