controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conform systems to Federal Identity, Credential and Access Management (FICAM)-issued profiles.

controls.title: Disassociability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to disassociate user attributes or credential assertion relationships among individuals, credential service providers and relying parties.

controls.title: Identification & Authentication for Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to uniquely identify and authenticate devices before establishing a connection using bidirectional authentication that is cryptographically- based and replay resistant.

controls.title: Device Attestation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure device identification and authentication is accurate by centrally-managing the joining of systems to the domain as part of the initial asset configuration management process.

controls.title: Identification & Authentication for Third Party Systems & Services
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and authenticate third-party systems and services.

controls.title: Sharing Identification & Authentication Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure third-party service providers provide current and accurate information for any third-party user with access to the organization's data or assets.

controls.title: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
controls.summary:
Automated mechanisms exist to enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for:
 ▪ Remote network access; and/ or
 ▪ Non-console access to critical systems or systems that store, transmit and/or process sensitive data.

controls.title: Network Access to Privileged Accounts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate network access for privileged accounts.

controls.title: Network Access to Non-Privileged Accounts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate network access for non-privileged accounts.

controls.title: Local Access to Privileged Accounts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) to authenticate local access for privileged accounts.

controls.title: Out-of-Band Multi-Factor Authentication
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for remote access to privileged and non-privileged accounts such that one of the factors is securely provided by a device separate from the system gaining access.

controls.title: User Provisioning & De-Provisioning
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a formal user registration and de-registration process that governs the assignment of access rights.

controls.title: Change of Roles & Duties
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to revoke user access rights following changes in personnel roles and duties, if no longer necessary or permitted.

controls.title: Termination of Employment
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to revoke user access rights in a timely manner, upon termination of employment or contract.

controls.title: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce a Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) policy over users and resources that applies need-to-know and fine-grained access control for sensitive data access.

controls.title: Identifier Management (User Names)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern naming standards for usernames and systems.

controls.title: User Identity (ID) Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure proper user identification management for non-consumer users and administrators.

controls.title: Identity User Status
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify contractor and other third-party users through unique username characteristics.

controls.title: Dynamic Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to dynamically manage usernames and system identifiers.

controls.title: Cross-Organization Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to coordinate username identifiers with external organizations for cross-organization management of identifiers.

controls.title: Privileged Account Identifiers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to uniquely manage privileged accounts to identify the account as a privileged user or service.

controls.title: Pairwise Pseudonymous Identifiers (PPID)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to generate pairwise pseudonymous identifiers with no identifying information about a data subject to discourage activity tracking and profiling of the data subject.

controls.title: Authenticator Management (Passwords)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to securely manage passwords for users and devices.

controls.title: Password-Based Authentication
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce complexity, length and lifespan considerations to ensure strong criteria for password-based authentication.

controls.title: PKI-Based Authentication
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to validate certificates by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor including checking certificate status information for PKI-based authentication.

controls.title: In-Person or Trusted Third-Party Registration
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct in-person or trusted third-party identify verification before user accounts for third-parties are created.

controls.title: Automated Support For Password Strength
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to determine if password authenticators are sufficiently strong enough to satisfy organization-defined password length and complexity controls.

controls.title: Protection of Authenticators
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect authenticators commensurate with the sensitivity of the information to which use of the authenticator permits access.

controls.title: No Embedded Unencrypted Static Authenticators
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that unencrypted, static authenticators are not embedded in applications, scripts or stored on function keys.

controls.title: Hardware Token-Based Authentication
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to ensure organization-defined token quality controls are satisfied for hardware token-based authentication.

controls.title: Vendor-Supplied Defaults
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure vendor-supplied defaults are changed as part of the installation process.

controls.title: Multiple Information System Accounts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement security safeguards to manage the risk of compromise due to individuals having accounts on multiple information systems.

controls.title: Expiration of Cached Authenticators
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to prohibit the use of cached authenticators after organization-defined time period.

controls.title: Authenticator Feedback
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to obscure the feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect the information from possible exploitation/use by unauthorized individuals.

controls.title: Cryptographic Module Authentication
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure cryptographic modules adhere to applicable statutory, regulatory and contractual controls for security strength.

controls.title: Adaptive Identification & Authentication
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to allow individuals to utilize alternative methods of authentication under specific circumstances or situations.

controls.title: Re-Authentication
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to force users and devices to re-authenticate according to organization-defined circumstances that necessitate re-authentication.

controls.title: Account Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to proactively govern account management of individual, group, system, application, guest and temporary accounts.

controls.title: Automated System Account Management
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to support the management of system accounts.

controls.title: Removal of Temporary / Emergency Accounts
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to disable or remove temporary and emergency accounts after an organization-defined time period for each type of account.

controls.title: Disable Inactive Accounts
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to disable inactive accounts after an organization-defined time period.

controls.title: Automated Audit Actions
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling and removal actions and notify organization-defined personnel or roles.

controls.title: Restrictions on Shared Groups / Accounts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to authorize the use of shared/group accounts only under certain organization-defined conditions.

controls.title: Account Disabling for High Risk Individuals
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to disable accounts immediately upon notification for users posing a significant risk to the organization.

controls.title: System Accounts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to review all system accounts and disable any account that cannot be associated with a business process and owner.

controls.title: Usage Conditions
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce usage conditions for users and/or roles.

controls.title: Privileged Account Management (PAM)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict and control privileged access rights for users and services.

controls.title: Privileged Account Inventories
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to inventory all privileged accounts and validate that each person with elevated privileges is authorized by the appropriate level of organizational management.

controls.title: Periodic Review
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to periodically review the privileges assigned to users to validate the need for such privileges; and reassign or remove privileges, if necessary, to correctly reflect organizational mission and business needs.

controls.title: User Responsibilities for Account Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to compel users to follow accepted practices in the use of authentication mechanisms (e.g., passwords, passphrases, physical or logical security tokens, smart cards, certificates, etc.).

controls.title: Credential Sharing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent the sharing of generic IDs, passwords or other generic authentication methods.

controls.title: Access Enforcement
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce logical access permissions through the principle of "least privilege."

controls.title: Access To Sensitive Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit access to sensitive data to only those individuals whose job requires such access.

controls.title: Database Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict access to database containing sensitive data to only necessary services or those individuals whose job requires such access.

controls.title: Use of Privileged Utility Programs
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict and tightly control utility programs that are capable of overriding system and application controls.

controls.title: Dedicated Administrative Machines
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict executing administrative tasks or tasks requiring elevated access to a dedicated machine.

controls.title: Dual Authorization for Privileged Commands
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce dual authorization for privileged commands.

controls.title: Least Privilege
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize the concept of least privilege, allowing only authorized access to processes necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in accordance with organizational business functions.

controls.title: Authorize Access to Security Functions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit access to security functions to explicitly-authorized privileged users.

controls.title: Non-Privileged Access for Non-Security Functions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit privileged users from using privileged accounts, while performing non-security functions.

controls.title: Privileged Accounts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the assignment of privileged accounts to organization-defined personnel or roles without management approval.

controls.title: Auditing Use of Privileged Functions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to audit the execution of privileged functions.

controls.title: Prohibit Non-Privileged Users from Executing Privileged Functions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing or altering implemented security safeguards / countermeasures.

controls.title: Network Access to Privileged Commands
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to authorize remote access to perform privileged commands on critical systems or where sensitive data is stored, transmitted and/or processed only for compelling operational needs.

controls.title: Privilege Levels for Code Execution
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to prevent applications from executing at higher privilege levels than the user's privileges.

controls.title: Account Lockout
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce a limit for consecutive invalid login attempts by a user during an organization-defined time period and automatically locks the account when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.

controls.title: Concurrent Session Control
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit the number of concurrent sessions for each system account.

controls.title: Session Lock
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to initiate a session lock after an organization-defined time period of inactivity, or upon receiving a request from a user and retain the session lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication methods.

controls.title: Pattern-Hiding Displays
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement pattern-hiding displays to conceal information previously visible on the display during the session lock.

controls.title: Session Termination
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to log out users, both locally on the network and for remote sessions, at the end of the session or after an organization-defined period of inactivity.

controls.title: User-Initiated Logouts / Message Displays
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide a logout capability and display an explicit logout message to users indicating the reliable termination of the session.

controls.title: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authorization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and document the supporting rationale for specific user actions that can be performed on a system without identification or authentication.

controls.title: Reference Monitor
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement a reference monitor that is tamperproof, always-invoked, small enough to be subject to analysis / testing and the completeness of which can be assured.

controls.title: Identity Proofing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to collect, validate and verify identity evidence of a user.

controls.title: Supervisor Authorization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require the registration process to receive supervisor or sponsor authorization for new accounts.

controls.title: Identity Evidence
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require evidence of individual identification to be presented to the registration authority.

controls.title: Identity Evidence Validation & Verification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require that the presented identity evidence be validated and verified through organizational-defined methods of validation and verification.

controls.title: In-Person Validation & Verification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require that the validation and verification of identity evidence be conducted in person before a designated registration authority.

controls.title: Address Confirmation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require that a notice of proofing be delivered through an out-of-band channel to verify the user's address (physical or digital).

controls.title: Incident Response Operations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement and govern processes and documentation to facilitate an organization-wide response capability for security and privacy-related incidents.

controls.title: Incident Handling
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to cover the preparation, automated detection or intake of incident reporting, analysis, containment, eradication and recovery.

controls.title: Automated Incident Handling Processes
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to support the incident handling process.

controls.title: Insider Threat Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement and govern an insider threat program.

controls.title: Dynamic Reconfiguration
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to dynamically reconfigure information system components as part of the incident response capability.

controls.title: Continuity of Operations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify classes of incidents and actions to take to ensure the continuation of organizational missions and business functions.

controls.title: Correlation with External Organizations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to coordinate with approved third-parties to achieve a cross-organization perspective on incident awareness and more effective incident responses.

controls.title: Indicators of Compromise (IOC)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define specific Indicators of Compromise (IOC) to identify the signs of potential cybersecurity events.

controls.title: Incident Response Plan (IRP)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain and make available a current and viable Incident Response Plan (IRP) to all stakeholders.

controls.title: Personal Data (PD) Processes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address Personal Data (PD) incidents according to applicable laws, regulations and contractual obligations.

controls.title: IRP Update
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to regularly update incident response strategies to keep current with business needs, technology changes and regulatory controls.

controls.title: Incident Response Training
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to train personnel in their incident response roles and responsibilities.

controls.title: Simulated Incidents
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to incorporate simulated events into incident response training to facilitate effective response by personnel in crisis situations.

controls.title: Automated Incident Response Training Environments
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to provide a more thorough and realistic incident response training environment.

controls.title: Incident Response Testing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to formally test incident response capabilities through realistic exercises to determine the operational effectiveness of those capabilities.

controls.title: Coordination with Related Plans
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to coordinate incident response testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

controls.title: Integrated Security Incident Response Team (ISIRT)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish an integrated team of cybersecurity, IT and business function representatives that are capable of addressing cybersecurity and privacy incident response operations.

controls.title: Chain of Custody & Forensics
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform digital forensics and maintain the integrity of the chain of custody, in accordance with applicable laws, regulations and industry-recognized secure practices.

controls.title: Situational Awareness For Incidents
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to document, monitor and report the status of cybersecurity and privacy incidents to internal stakeholders all the way through the resolution of the incident.

controls.title: Automated Tracking, Data Collection & Analysis
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to assist in the tracking, collection and analysis of information from actual and potential security and privacy incidents.

controls.title: Incident Stakeholder Reporting
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to timely-report incidents to applicable:
 ▪ Internal stakeholders ; 
 ▪ Affected clients & third-parties; and
 ▪ Regulatory authorities.

controls.title: Automated Reporting
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to assist in the reporting of security and privacy incidents.

controls.title: Cyber Incident Reporting for Sensitive Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to report sensitive data incidents in a timely manner.

controls.title: Vulnerabilities Related To Incidents
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to report system vulnerabilities associated with reported security and privacy incidents to organization-defined personnel or roles.

controls.title: Supply Chain Coordination
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide security and privacy incident information to the provider of the product or service and other organizations involved in the supply chain for systems or system components related to the incident.

controls.title: Incident Reporting Assistance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide incident response advice and assistance to users of systems for the handling and reporting of actual and potential security and privacy incidents.

controls.title: Automation Support of Availability of Information / Support
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to increase the availability of incident response-related information and support.

controls.title: Coordination With External Providers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish a direct, cooperative relationship between the organization's incident response capability and external service providers.

controls.title: Information Spillage Response
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to respond to sensitive information spills.

controls.title: Responsible Personnel
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to formally assign personnel or roles with responsibility for responding to sensitive information spills.

controls.title: Training
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure incident response training material provides coverage for sensitive information spillage response.

controls.title: Post-Spill Operations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that organizational personnel impacted by sensitive information spills can continue to carry out assigned tasks while contaminated systems are undergoing corrective actions.

controls.title: Exposure to Unauthorized Personnel
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address security safeguards for personnel exposed to sensitive information that is not within their assigned access authorizations.

controls.title: Root Cause Analysis (RCA) & Lessons Learned
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to incorporate lessons learned from analyzing and resolving cybersecurity and privacy incidents to reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents.

controls.title: Regulatory & Law Enforcement Contacts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain incident response contacts with applicable regulatory and law enforcement agencies.

controls.title: Detonation Chambers (Sandboxes)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a detonation chamber capability to detect and/or block potentially-malicious files and email attachments

controls.title: Information Assurance (IA) Operations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of cybersecurity and privacy assessment and authorization controls.

controls.title: Assessments
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to formally assess the cybersecurity and privacy controls in systems, applications and services through Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting expected controls.

controls.title: Assessor Independence
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure assessors or assessment teams have the appropriate independence to conduct cybersecurity and privacy control assessments.

controls.title: Specialized Assessments
Third-Party Assessments
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to accept and respond to the results of external assessments that are performed by impartial, external organizations.

controls.title: System Security Plans (SSP)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to generate System Security Plans (SSPs), or similar document repositories, to identify and maintain key architectural information on each critical system, application or service, as well as influencing inputs, entities, systems, applications and processes, providing a historical record of the data and its origins.

controls.title: Plan / Coordinate with Other Organizational Entities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to plan and coordinate Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities with affected stakeholders before conducting such activities in order to reduce the potential impact on operations.

controls.title: Adequate Security for Sensitive Data In Support of Contracts
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect sensitive data that is collected, developed, received, transmitted, used or stored in support of the performance of a contract.

controls.title: Threat Analysis & Flaw Remediation During Development
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require system developers and integrators to create and execute a Security Test and Evaluation (ST&E) plan to identify and remediate flaws during development.

controls.title: Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to generate a Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M), or similar risk register, to document planned remedial actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of the security controls and to reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities.

controls.title: Technical Verification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform Information Assurance Program (IAP) activities to evaluate the design, implementation and effectiveness of technical security and privacy controls.

controls.title: Security Authorization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure systems, projects and services are officially authorized prior to "go live" in a production environment.

controls.title: Maintenance Operations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop, disseminate, review & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of maintenance controls across the enterprise.

controls.title: Controlled Maintenance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct controlled maintenance activities throughout the lifecycle of the system, application or service.

controls.title: Automated Maintenance Activities
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to schedule, conduct and document maintenance and repairs.

controls.title: Timely Maintenance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to obtain maintenance support and/or spare parts for systems within a defined Recovery Time Objective (RTO).

controls.title: Preventative Maintenance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform preventive maintenance on critical systems, applications and services.

controls.title: Predictive Maintenance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform predictive maintenance on critical systems, applications and services.

controls.title: Automated Support For Predictive Maintenance
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to transfer predictive maintenance data to a computerized maintenance management system.

controls.title: Maintenance Tools
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.

controls.title: Inspect Tools
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to inspect maintenance tools carried into a facility by maintenance personnel for improper or unauthorized modifications.

controls.title: Inspect Media
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before the media are used.

controls.title: Prevent Unauthorized Removal
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent or control the removal of equipment undergoing maintenance that containing organizational information.

controls.title: Restrict Tool Usage
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to restrict the use of maintenance tools to authorized maintenance personnel and/or roles.

controls.title: Non-Local Maintenance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to authorize, monitor and control non-local maintenance and diagnostic activities.

controls.title: Auditing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to audit non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions and review the maintenance records of the sessions.

controls.title: Notification of Non-Local Maintenance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require maintenance personnel to notify organization-defined personnel when non-local maintenance is planned (e.g., date/time).

controls.title: Cryptographic Protection
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the integrity and confidentiality of non-local maintenance and diagnostic communications.

controls.title: Remote Disconnect Verification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide remote disconnect verification to ensure non-local maintenance and diagnostic sessions are properly terminated.

controls.title: Pre-Approval of Non-Local Maintenance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require maintenance personnel to obtain pre-approval and scheduling for non-local maintenance sessions.

controls.title: Comparable Security & Sanitization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require systems performing non-local maintenance and / or diagnostic services implement a security capability comparable to the capability implemented on the system being serviced.

controls.title: Authorized Maintenance Personnel
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain a current list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel.

controls.title: Maintenance Personnel Without Appropriate Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure the risks associated with maintenance personnel who do not have appropriate access authorizations, clearances or formal access approvals are appropriately mitigated.

controls.title: Non-System Related Maintenance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that non-escorted personnel performing non-IT maintenance activities in the physical proximity of IT systems have required access authorizations.

controls.title: Centralized Management Of Mobile Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop, govern & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of mobile device management controls.

controls.title: Access Control For Mobile Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce access control controls for the connection of mobile devices to organizational systems.

controls.title: Full Device & Container-Based Encryption
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information on mobile devices through full-device or container encryption.

controls.title: Mobile Device Tampering
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect mobile devices from tampering through inspecting devices returning from locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk, prior to the device being connected to the organization’s network.

controls.title: Remote Purging
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to remotely purge selected information from mobile devices.

controls.title: Personally-Owned Mobile Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the connection of personally-owned, mobile devices to organizational systems and networks.

controls.title: Organization-Owned Mobile Devices
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the installation of non-approved applications or approved applications not obtained through the organization-approved application store.

controls.title: Mobile Device Data Retention Limitations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit data retention on mobile devices to the smallest usable dataset and timeframe.

controls.title: Network Security Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop, govern & update procedures to facilitate the implementation of network security controls.

controls.title: Layered Network Defenses
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement security functions as a layered structure that minimizes interactions between layers of the design and avoiding any dependence by lower layers on the functionality or correctness of higher layers.

controls.title: Denial of Service (DoS) Protection
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to protect against or limit the effects of denial of service attacks.

controls.title: Guest Networks
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement and manage a secure guest network.

controls.title: Boundary Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor and control communications at the external network boundary and at key internal boundaries within the network.

controls.title: Network Access Points
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit network access points.

controls.title: External Telecommunications Services
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain a managed interface for each external telecommunication service that protects the confidentiality and integrity of the information being transmitted across each interface.

controls.title: Prevent Discovery of Internal Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent the public disclosure of internal network information.

controls.title: Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to apply network-based processing rules to data elements of Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Prevent Unauthorized Exfiltration
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to prevent the unauthorized exfiltration of sensitive data across managed interfaces.

controls.title: Dynamic Isolation & Segregation (Sandboxing)
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to dynamically isolate (e.g., sandbox) untrusted components during runtime, where the component is isolated in a fault-contained environment but it can still collaborate with the application.

controls.title: Isolation of Information System Components (DMZ)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to employ boundary protections to isolate systems, services and process that support critical missions and/or business functions.

controls.title: Separate Subnet for Connecting to Different Security Domains
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement separate network addresses (e.g., different subnets) to connect to systems in different security domains.

controls.title: Data Flow Enforcement – Access Control Lists (ACLs)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to design, implement and review firewall and router configurations to restrict connections between untrusted networks and internal systems.

controls.title: Deny Traffic by Default & Allow Traffic by Exception
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure firewall and router configurations to deny network traffic by default and allow network traffic by exception (e.g., deny all, permit by exception).

controls.title: Object Security Attributes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to associate security attributes with information, source and destination objects to enforce defined information flow control configurations as a basis for flow control decisions.

controls.title: Content Check for Encrypted Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent encrypted data from bypassing content-checking mechanisms.

controls.title: Embedded Data Types
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce limitations on embedding data within other data types.

controls.title: Metadata
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce information flow controls based on metadata.

controls.title: Human Reviews
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enforce the use of human reviews for Access Control Lists (ACLs) and similar rulesets on a routine basis.

controls.title: Security Policy Filters
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to enforce information flow control using security policy filters as a basis for flow control decisions.

controls.title: Data Type Identifiers
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to utilize data type identifiers to validate data essential for information flow decisions when transferring information between different security domains.

controls.title: Decomposition Into Policy-Related Subcomponents
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to decompose information into policy-relevant subcomponents for submission to policy enforcement mechanisms, when transferring information between different security domains.

controls.title: Detection of Unsanctioned Information
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to implement security policy filters requiring fully enumerated formats that restrict data structure and content, when transferring information between different security domains.

controls.title: Approved Solutions
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to examine information for the presence of unsanctioned information and prohibits the transfer of such information, when transferring information between different security domains.

controls.title: System Interconnections
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to authorize connections from systems to other systems using Interconnection Security Agreements (ISAs) that document, for each interconnection, the interface characteristics, security and privacy controls and the nature of the information communicated.

controls.title: External System Connections
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the direct connection of a sensitive system to an external network without the use of an organization-defined boundary protection device.

controls.title: Internal System Connections
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control internal system connections through authorizing internal connections of systems and documenting, for each internal connection, the interface characteristics, security controls and the nature of the information communicated.

controls.title: Network Segmentation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to logically or physically segment information flows to accomplish network segmentation.

controls.title: Security Management Subnets
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement security management subnets to isolate security tools and support components from other internal system components by implementing separate subnetworks with managed interfaces to other components of the system.

controls.title: Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN) Separation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enable Virtual Local Area Networks (VLANs) to limit the ability of devices on a network to directly communicate with other devices on the subnet and limit an attacker's ability to laterally move to compromise neighboring systems.

controls.title: Network Disconnect
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to terminate remote sessions at the end of the session or after an organization-defined time period of inactivity.

controls.title: Network Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (NIDS / NIPS)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to employ Network Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (NIDS/NIPS) to detect and/or prevent intrusions into the network.

controls.title: DMZ Networks
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require De-Militarized Zone (DMZ) network segments to separate untrusted networks from trusted networks.

controls.title: Wireless Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (WIDS / WIPS)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require wireless network segments to implement Wireless Intrusion Detection / Prevention Systems (WIDS/WIPS) technologies.

controls.title: Session Authenticity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

controls.title: Invalidate Session Identifiers at Logout
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to invalidate session identifiers upon user logout or other session termination.

controls.title: Domain Name Service (DNS) Resolution
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution is designed, implemented and managed to protect the security of name / address resolution.

controls.title: Architecture & Provisioning for Name / Address Resolution Service
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure systems that collectively provide Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution service for are fault-tolerant and implement internal/external role separation.

controls.title: Secure Name / Address Resolution Service (Recursive or Caching Resolver)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform data origin authentication and data integrity verification on the Domain Name Service (DNS) resolution responses received from authoritative sources when requested by client systems.

controls.title: Out-of-Band Channels
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize out-of-band channels for the electronic transmission of information and/or the physical shipment of system components or devices to authorized individuals.

controls.title: Safeguarding Data Over Open Networks
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to implement strong cryptography and security protocols to safeguard sensitive data during transmission over open, public networks.

controls.title: Wireless Link Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect external and internal wireless links from signal parameter attacks through monitoring for unauthorized wireless connections, including scanning for unauthorized wireless access points and taking appropriate action, if an unauthorized connection is discovered.

controls.title: End-User Messaging Technologies
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prohibit the transmission of unprotected sensitive data by end-user messaging technologies.

controls.title: Electronic Messaging
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to protect information involved in electronic messaging communications.

controls.title: Remote Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define, control and review remote access methods.

controls.title: Automated Monitoring & Control
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to monitor and control remote access sessions.

controls.title: Protection of Confidentiality / Integrity Using Encryption
controls.summary: Cryptographic mechanisms exist to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions.

controls.title: Managed Access Control Points
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to route all remote accesses through managed network access control points (e.g., VPN concentrator).

controls.title: Remote Privileged Commands & Sensitive Data Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the execution of privileged commands and access to security-relevant information via remote access only for compelling operational needs.

controls.title: Telecommuting
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern remote access to systems and data for remote workers.

controls.title: Third-Party Remote Access Governance
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to proactively control and monitor third-party accounts used to access, support, or maintain system components via remote access.

controls.title: Endpoint Security Validation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to validate software versions/patch levels and control remote devices connecting to corporate networks or storing and accessing organization information.

controls.title: Expeditious Disconnect / Disable Capability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide the capability to expeditiously disconnect or disable a user's remote access session.

controls.title: Wireless Networking
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control authorized wireless usage and monitor for unauthorized wireless access.

controls.title: Authentication & Encryption
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to exist to protect wireless access through authentication and strong encryption.

controls.title: Disable Wireless Networking
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to disable unnecessary wireless networking capabilities that are internally embedded within system components prior to issuance to end users.

controls.title: Restrict Configuration By Users
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and explicitly authorize users who are allowed to independently configure wireless networking capabilities.

controls.title: Wireless Boundaries
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to confine wireless communications to organization-controlled boundaries.

controls.title: Rogue Wireless Detection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to test for the presence of Wireless Access Points (WAPs) and identify all authorized and unauthorized WAPs within the facility(ies).

controls.title: Intranets
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to establish trust relationships with other organizations owning, operating, and/or maintaining intranet systems, allowing authorized individuals to: 
 ▪ Access the intranet from external systems; and
 ▪ Process, store, and/or transmit organization-controlled information using the external systems.

controls.title: Data Loss Prevention (DLP)
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to implement Data Loss Prevention (DLP) to protect sensitive information as it is stored, transmitted and processed.

controls.title: Content Filtering
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to force Internet-bound network traffic through a proxy device for URL content filtering and DNS filtering to limit a user's ability to connect to dangerous or prohibited Internet sites.

controls.title: Route Traffic to Proxy Servers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to route internal communications traffic to external networks through organization-approved proxy servers at managed interfaces.

controls.title: Physical & Environmental Protections
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the operation of physical and environmental protection controls.

controls.title: Physical Access Authorizations
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to maintain a current list of personnel with authorized access to organizational facilities (except for those areas within the facility officially designated as publicly accessible).

controls.title: Role-Based Physical Access
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to authorize physical access to facilities based on the position or role of the individual.

controls.title: Physical Access Control
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to enforce physical access authorizations for all physical access points (including designated entry/exit points) to facilities (excluding those areas within the facility officially designated as publicly accessible).

controls.title: Controlled Ingress & Egress Points
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to limit and monitor physical access through controlled ingress and egress points.

controls.title: Lockable Physical Casings
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to protect system components from unauthorized physical access (e.g., lockable physical casings).

controls.title: Physical Access Logs
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to generate a log entry for each access through controlled ingress and egress points.

controls.title: Access To Information Systems
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to enforce physical access to critical information systems or sensitive data, in addition to the physical access controls for the facility.

controls.title: Physical Security of Offices, Rooms & Facilities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify systems, equipment and respective operating environments that require limited physical access so that appropriate physical access control are designed and implemented for offices, rooms and facilities.

controls.title: Working in Secure Areas
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to allow only authorized personnel access to secure areas.

controls.title: Monitoring Physical Access
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to monitor for, detect and respond to physical security incidents.

controls.title: Intrusion Alarms / Surveillance Equipment
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to monitor physical intrusion alarms and surveillance equipment.

controls.title: Monitoring Physical Access To Information Systems
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to monitor physical access to critical information systems or sensitive data, in addition to the physical access monitoring of the facility.

controls.title: Visitor Control
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to identify, authorize and monitor visitors before allowing access to the facility (other than areas designated as publicly accessible).

controls.title: Distinguish Visitors from On-Site Personnel
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to easily distinguish between onsite personnel and visitors, especially in areas where sensitive data is accessible.

controls.title: Identification Requirement
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to requires at least one (1) form of government-issued photo identification to authenticate individuals before they can gain access to the facility.

controls.title: Restrict Unescorted Access
controls.summary: Physical access control mechanisms exist to restrict unescorted access to facilities to personnel with required security clearances, formal access authorizations and validated the need for access.

controls.title: Automated Records Management & Review
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to facilitate the maintenance and review of visitor access records.

controls.title: Supporting Utilities
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to protect power equipment and power cabling for the system from damage and destruction.

controls.title: Automatic Voltage Controls
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to utilize automatic voltage controls for critical system components.

controls.title: Emergency Shutoff
controls.summary:
Facility security mechanisms exist to shut off power in emergency situations by:
 ▪ Placing emergency shutoff switches or devices in close proximity to systems or system components to facilitate safe and easy access for personnel; and
 ▪ Protecting emergency power shutoff capability from unauthorized activation.

controls.title: Emergency Power
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to supply long-term alternate power that is capable of maintaining minimally-required operational capability in the event of an extended loss of the primary power source

controls.title: Emergency Lighting
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to utilize and maintain automatic emergency lighting that activates in the event of a power outage or disruption and that covers emergency exits and evacuation routes within the facility.

controls.title: Water Damage Protection
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to protect systems from damage resulting from water leakage by providing master shutoff valves that are accessible, working properly and known to key personnel.

controls.title: Automation Support for Water Damage Protection
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to detect the presence of water in the vicinity of critical information systems and alert facility maintenance and IT personnel.

controls.title: Fire Protection
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to utilize and maintain fire suppression and detection devices/systems for the system that are supported by an independent energy source.

controls.title: Fire Detection Devices
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to utilize and maintain fire detection devices/systems that activate automatically and notify organizational personnel and emergency responders in the event of a fire.

controls.title: Fire Suppression Devices
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to utilize fire suppression devices/systems that provide automatic notification of any activation to organizational personnel and emergency responders.

controls.title: Automatic Fire Suppression
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to employ an automatic fire suppression capability for critical information systems when the facility is not staffed on a continuous basis.

controls.title: Temperature & Humidity Controls
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to maintain and monitor temperature and humidity levels within the facility.

controls.title: Monitoring with Alarms / Notifications
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to trigger an alarm or notification of temperature and humidity changes that be potentially harmful to personnel or equipment.

controls.title: Delivery & Removal
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to isolate information processing facilities from points such as delivery and loading areas and other points to avoid unauthorized access.

controls.title: Alternate Work Site
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to utilize appropriate management, operational and technical controls at alternate work sites.

controls.title: Equipment Siting & Protection
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to locate system components within the facility to minimize potential damage from physical and environmental hazards and to minimize the opportunity for unauthorized access.

controls.title: Access Control for Transmission Medium
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to protect power and telecommunications cabling carrying data or supporting information services from interception, interference or damage.

controls.title: Access Control for Output Devices
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to restrict access to printers and other system output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining the output.

controls.title: Information Leakage Due To Electromagnetic Signals Emanations
controls.summary: Facility security mechanisms exist to protect the system from information leakage due to electromagnetic signals emanations.

controls.title: Asset Monitoring and Tracking
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to employ asset location technologies that track and monitor the location and movement of organization-defined assets within organization-defined controlled areas.

controls.title: Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP) Protection
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to employ safeguards against Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP) damage for systems and system components.

controls.title: Component Marking
controls.summary: Physical security mechanisms exist to mark system hardware components indicating the impact or classification level of the information permitted to be processed, stored or transmitted by the hardware component.

controls.title: Privacy Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation and operation of privacy controls.

controls.title: Chief Privacy Officer (CPO)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to appoints a Chief Privacy Officer (CPO) or similar role, with the authority, mission, accountability and resources to coordinate, develop and implement, applicable privacy controls and manage privacy risks through the organization-wide privacy program.

controls.title: Privacy Act Statements
Dissemination of Privacy Program Information
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to: 
 ▪ Ensure that the public has access to information about organizational privacy activities and can communicate with its Chief Privacy Officer (CPO) or similar role;
 ▪ Ensure that organizational privacy practices are publicly available through organizational websites or otherwise; and
 ▪ Utilize publicly facing email addresses and/or phone lines to enable the public to provide feedback and/or direct questions to privacy offices regarding privacy practices.

controls.title: Data Protection Officer (DPO)
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to appoint a Data Protection Officer (DPO):
 ▪ Based on the basis of professional qualities; and
 ▪ To be involved in all issues related to the protection of personal data.

controls.title: Privacy Notice
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to:
 ▪ Make privacy notice(s) available to individuals upon first interacting with an organization and subsequently as necessary; and
 ▪ Ensure that privacy notices are clear and easy-to-understand, expressing information about Personal Data (PD) processing in plain language that meet all legal obligations

controls.title: Purpose Specification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and document the purpose(s) for which Personal Data (PD) is collected, used, maintained and shared in its privacy notices.

controls.title: Automated Data Management Processes
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to adjust data that is able to be collected, created, used, disseminated, maintained, retained and/or disclosed, based on updated data subject authorization(s).

controls.title: Computer Matching Agreements (CMA)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to publish Computer Matching Agreements (CMA) on the public website of the organization.

controls.title: Choice & Consent
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to authorize the processing of their Personal Data (PD) prior to its collection that:
 ▪ Uses plain language and provide examples to illustrate the potential privacy risks of the authorization; and
 ▪ Provides a means for users to decline the authorization.

controls.title: Attribute Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to allow data subjects to tailor use permissions to selected attributes.

controls.title: Just-In-Time Notice & Updated Consent
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to present authorizations to process Personal Data (PD) in conjunction with the data action, when:
▪ The original circumstances under which an individual gave consent have changed; or
▪ A significant amount of time has passed since an individual gave consent.

controls.title: Prohibition Of Selling Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent the sale of Personal Data (PD) when instructed by the data subject.

controls.title: Collection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to collect Personal Data (PD) only for the purposes identified in the privacy notice and includes protections against collecting PD from minors without appropriate parental consent.

controls.title: Authority To Collect, Use, Maintain & Share Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to determine and document the legal authority that permits the collection, use, maintenance and sharing of Personal Data (PD), either generally or in support of a specific program or system need.

controls.title: Use, Retention & Disposal
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to: 
 ▪ Retain Personal Data (PD), including metadata, for an organization-defined time period to fulfill the purpose(s) identified in the notice or as required by law;
 ▪ Dispose of, destroys, erases, and/or anonymizes the PI, regardless of the method of storage; and
 ▪ Use organization-defined techniques or methods to ensure secure deletion or destruction of PD (including originals, copies and archived records).

controls.title: Internal Use
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to address the use of Personal Data (PD) for internal testing, training and research that:
 ▪ Takes measures to limit or minimize the amount of PD used for internal testing, training and research purposes; and
 ▪ Authorizes the use of PD when such information is required for internal testing, training and research.

controls.title: Data Integrity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to confirm the accuracy and relevance of Personal Data (PD), as data is obtained and used across the information lifecycle.

controls.title: Data Masking
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to mask sensitive information that is displayed or printed.

controls.title: Usage Restrictions of Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the use of Personal Data (PD) to only the authorized purpose(s) consistent with applicable laws, regulations and in privacy notices.

controls.title: Inventory of Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish, maintain and update an inventory that contains a listing of all programs and systems identified as collecting, using, maintaining, or sharing Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Personal Data (PD) Inventory Automation Support
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to determine if Personal Data (PD) is maintained in electronic form.

controls.title: Data Subject Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide individuals the ability to access their Personal Data (PD) maintained in organizational systems of records.

controls.title: Redress Inaccurate Information
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to establish and implement a process for:
 ▪ Individuals to have inaccurate Personal Data (PD) maintained by the organization corrected or amended; and
 ▪ Disseminating corrections or amendments of PD to other authorized users of the PI.

controls.title: Notice of Correction or Processing Change
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to notify affected individuals if their Personal Data (PD) has been corrected or amended.

controls.title: Appeal Adverse Decision
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide an organization-defined process for individuals to appeal an adverse decision and have incorrect information amended.

controls.title: User Feedback Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement a process for receiving and responding to complaints, concerns or questions from individuals about the organizational privacy practices.

controls.title: Right to Erasure
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to erase personal data of an individual, without delay.

controls.title: Data Portability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to export Personal Data (PD) in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format that allows the data subject to transmit the data to another controller without hindrance.

controls.title: Personal Data Exportability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to digitally export Personal Data (PD) in a secure manner upon request by the data subject.

controls.title: Information Sharing With Third Parties
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to discloses Personal Data (PD) to third-parties only for the purposes identified in the privacy notice and with the implicit or explicit consent of the data subject.

controls.title: Privacy controls for Contractors & Service Providers
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to includes privacy controls in contracts and other acquisition-related documents that establish privacy roles and responsibilities for contractors and service providers.

controls.title: Joint Processing of Personal Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to clearly define and communicate the organization's role in processing Personal Data (PD) in the data processing ecosystem.

controls.title: Obligation To Inform Third-Parties
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to inform applicable third-parties to any modification, deletion or other change that affects shared Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Reject Unauthorized Disclosure Requests
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to reject unauthorized disclosure requests.

controls.title: Testing, Training & Monitoring
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement a process for ensuring that organizational plans for conducting security and privacy testing, training and monitoring activities associated with organizational systems are developed and performed.

controls.title: Personal Data Lineage
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a record of processing activities to maintain a record of Personal Data (PD) that is stored, transmitted and/or processed under the organization's responsibility.

controls.title: Data Quality Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to issue guidelines ensuring and maximizing the quality, utility, objectivity, integrity, impact determination and de-identification of Personal Data (PD) across the information lifecycle.

controls.title: Automation
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to support the evaluation of data quality across the information lifecycle.

controls.title: Data Analytics Bias
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to evaluate its analytical processes for potential bias.

controls.title: Data Tagging
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to issue data modeling guidelines to support tagging of sensitive data.

controls.title: Updating Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop processes to identify and record the method under which Personal Data (PD) is updated and the frequency that such updates occur.

controls.title: Data Management Board
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish a written charter for a Data Management Board (DMB) and assigned organization-defined roles to the DMB.

controls.title: Privacy Records & Reporting
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain privacy-related records and develop, disseminate and update reports to internal senior management, as well as external oversight bodies, as appropriate, to demonstrate accountability with specific statutory and regulatory privacy program mandates.

controls.title: Accounting of Disclosures
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop and maintain an accounting of disclosures of Personal Data (PD) held by the organization and make the accounting of disclosures available to the person named in the record, upon request.

controls.title: Notification of Disclosure Request To Data Subject
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to notify data subjects of applicable legal requests to disclose Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Register Database
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to register databases containing Personal Data (PD) with the appropriate Data Authority, when necessary.

controls.title: Security Portfolio Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of security and privacy-related resource planning controls that define a viable plan for achieving cybersecurity & privacy objectives.

controls.title: Strategic Plan & Objectives
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish a strategic cybersecurity and privacy-specific business plan and set of objectives to achieve that plan.

controls.title: Targeted Capability Maturity Levels
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define and identify targeted capability maturity levels.

controls.title: Security & Privacy Resource Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address all capital planning and investment requests, including the resources needed to implement the security & privacy programs and documents all exceptions to this requirement.

controls.title: Allocation of Resources
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and allocate resources for management, operational, technical and privacy controls within business process planning for projects / initiatives.

controls.title: Security & Privacy In Project Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to assess security and privacy controls in system project development to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting the controls.

controls.title: Security & Privacy controls Definition
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify critical system components and functions by performing a criticality analysis for critical systems, system components or services at pre-defined decision points in the Secure Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

controls.title: Business Process Definition
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to define business processes with consideration for cybersecurity and privacy that determines: 
 ▪ The resulting risk to organizational operations, assets, individuals and other organizations; and
 ▪ Information protection needs arising from the defined business processes and revises the processes as necessary, until an achievable set of protection needs is obtained.

controls.title: Secure Development Life Cycle (SDLC) Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure changes to systems within the Secure Development Life Cycle (SDLC) are controlled through formal change control procedures.

controls.title: Manage Organizational Knowledge
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to manage the organizational knowledge of the cybersecurity and privacy staff.

controls.title: Risk Management Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of risk management controls.

controls.title: Risk Framing
Risk-Based Security Categorization
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to categorizes systems and data in accordance with applicable local, state and Federal laws that:
 ▪ Document the security categorization results (including supporting rationale) in the security plan for systems; and
 ▪ Ensure the security categorization decision is reviewed and approved by the asset owner.

controls.title: Risk Identification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and document risks, both internal and external.

controls.title: Risk Assessment
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct an annual assessment of risk that includes the likelihood and magnitude of harm, from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, disruption, modification or destruction of the organization's systems and data.

controls.title: Risk Register
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain a risk register that facilitates monitoring and reporting of risks.

controls.title: Risk Ranking
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and assign a risk ranking to newly discovered security vulnerabilities that is based on industry-recognized practices.

controls.title: Risk Remediation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to remediate risks to an acceptable level.

controls.title: Risk Response
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to respond to findings from security and privacy assessments, incidents and audits to ensure proper remediation has been performed.

controls.title: Risk Assessment Update
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to routinely update risk assessments and react accordingly upon identifying new security vulnerabilities, including using outside sources for security vulnerability information.

controls.title: Business Impact Analysis (BIA)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct a Business Impact Analysis (BIA).

controls.title: Supply Chain Risk Management Plan
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop a plan for Supply Chain Risk Management (SCRM) associated with the development, acquisition, maintenance and disposal of systems, system components and services, including documenting selected mitigating actions and monitoring performance against those plans.

controls.title: Supply Chain Risk Assessment
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to periodically assess supply chain risks associated with systems, system components and services.

controls.title: Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct a Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) on systems, applications and services to evaluate privacy implications.

controls.title: Secure Engineering Principles
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of industry-recognized security and privacy practices in the specification, design, development, implementation and modification of systems and services.

controls.title: Centralized Management of Cybersecurity & Privacy Controls
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage the organization-wide management and implementation of cybersecurity and privacy controls and related processes.

controls.title: Alignment With Enterprise Architecture
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop an enterprise architecture, aligned with industry-recognized leading practices, with consideration for cybersecurity and privacy principles that addresses risk to organizational operations, assets, individuals, other organizations.

controls.title: Standardized Terminology
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to standardize technology and process terminology to reduce confusion amongst groups and departments.

controls.title: Defense-In-Depth (DiD) Architecture
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement security functions as a layered structure minimizing interactions between layers of the design and avoiding any dependence by lower layers on the functionality or correctness of higher layers.

controls.title: System Partitioning
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to partition systems so that partitions reside in separate physical domains or environments.

controls.title: Application Partitioning
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to separate user functionality from system management functionality.

controls.title: Process Isolation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement a separate execution domain for each executing process.

controls.title: Security Function Isolation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to isolate security functions from non-security functions.

controls.title: Hardware Separation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement underlying hardware separation mechanisms to facilitate process separation.

controls.title: Thread Separation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain a separate execution domain for each thread in multi-threaded processing.

controls.title: Information In Shared Resources
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

controls.title: Prevent Program Execution
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to prevent the execution of unauthorized software programs.

controls.title: Predictable Failure Analysis
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to determine the Mean Time to Failure (MTTF) for system components in specific environments of operation.

controls.title: Technology Lifecycle Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to manage the usable lifecycles of systems.

controls.title: Fail Secure
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to enable systems to fail to an organization-defined known-state for types of failures, preserving system state information in failure.

controls.title: Fail Safe
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement fail-safe procedures when failure conditions occur.

controls.title: Non-Persistence
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement non-persistent system components and services that are initiated in a known state and terminated upon the end of the session of use or periodically at an organization-defined frequency.

controls.title: Refresh from Trusted Sources
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensures that software and data needed for information system component and service refreshes are obtained from trusted sources.

controls.title: Information Output Filtering
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to validate information output from software programs and/or applications to ensure that the information is consistent with the expected content.

controls.title: Limit Personal Data (PD) Dissemination
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit the dissemination of Personal Data (PD) to organization-defined elements identified in the Data Protection Impact Assessment (DPIA) and consistent with authorized purposes.

controls.title: Memory Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement security safeguards to protect system memory from unauthorized code execution.

controls.title: Honeypots
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize honeypots that are specifically designed to be the target of malicious attacks for the purpose of detecting, deflecting and analyzing such attacks.

controls.title: Honeyclients
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize honeyclients that proactively seek to identify malicious websites and/or web-based malicious code.

controls.title: Heterogeneity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a diverse set of technologies for system components to reduce the impact of technical vulnerabilities from the same Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).

controls.title: Virtualization Techniques
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize virtualization techniques to support the employment of a diversity of operating systems and applications.

controls.title: Concealment & Misdirection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize concealment and misdirection techniques for systems to confuse and mislead adversaries.

controls.title: Randomness
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to introduce randomness into organizational operations and assets.

controls.title: Change Processing & Storage Locations
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to change the location of processing and/or storage at random time intervals.

controls.title: Distributed Processing & Storage
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to distribute processing and storage across multiple physical locations.

controls.title: Non-Modifiable Executable Programs
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize non-modifiable executable programs that load and execute the operating environment and applications from hardware-enforced, read-only media.

controls.title: Secure Log-On Procedures
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a trusted communications path between the user and the security functions of the system.

controls.title: System Use Notification (Logon Banner)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize system use notification / logon banners that display an approved system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices.

controls.title: Standardized Microsoft Windows Banner
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize displays a system use notification / logon banner for Active Directory (AD) users on Microsoft Windows devices before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices.

controls.title: Truncated Banner
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a truncated system use notification / logon banner on systems not capable of displaying a logon banner from a centralized source, such as Active Directory.

controls.title: Previous Logon Notification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to configure systems that process, store or transmit sensitive data to notify the user, upon successful logon, of the number of unsuccessful logon attempts since the last successful logon.

controls.title: Clock Synchronization
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize time-synchronization technology to synchronize all critical system clocks.

controls.title: Operations Security
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of operational security controls.

controls.title: Standardized Operating Procedures (SOP)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and document Standardized Operating Procedures (SOP), or similar documentation, to enable the proper execution of day-to-day / assigned tasks.

controls.title: Security Concept Of Operations (CONOPS)
