controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop a security Concept of Operations (CONOPS), or a similarly-defined plan for achieving cybersecurity objectives, that documents management, operational and technical measures implemented to apply defense-in-depth techniques that is communicated to all appropriate stakeholders.

controls.title:
Service Delivery
(Business Process Support)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define supporting business processes and implement appropriate governance and service management to ensure appropriate planning, delivery and support of the organization's technology capabilities supporting business functions, workforce, and/or customers based on industry-recognized standards to achieve the specific goals of the process area.

controls.title: Security Operations Center (SOC)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to establish and maintain a Security Operations Center (SOC) that facilitates a 24x7 response capability.

controls.title: Security & Privacy-Minded Workforce
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of security workforce development and awareness controls.

controls.title: Security & Privacy Awareness
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide all employees and contractors appropriate awareness education and training that is relevant for their job function.

controls.title: Practical Exercises
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to simulate actual cyber-attacks through practical exercises that are aligned with current threat scenarios are included in training.

controls.title: Social Engineering & Mining
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to include awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential and actual instances of social engineering and social mining.

controls.title: Role-Based Security & Privacy Training
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to provide role-based security-related training: 
 ▪ Before authorizing access to the system or performing assigned duties; 
 ▪ When required by system changes; and 
 ▪ Annually thereafter.

controls.title: Practical Exercises
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to include practical exercises in security and privacy training that reinforce training objectives.

controls.title: Suspicious Communications & Anomalous System Behavior
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide training to personnel on organization-defined indicators of malware to recognize suspicious communications and anomalous behavior.

controls.title: Sensitive Information Storage, Handling & Processing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that every user accessing a system processing, storing or transmitting sensitive information is formally trained in data handling controls.

controls.title: Vendor Security & Privacy Training
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to incorporate vendor-specific security training in support of new technology initiatives.

controls.title: Privileged Users
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provides specific training for privileged users to ensure privileged users understand their unique roles and responsibilities

controls.title: Security & Privacy Training Records
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to document, retain and monitor individual training activities, including basic security awareness training, ongoing awareness training and specific-system training.

controls.title: Technology Development & Acquisition
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of tailored development and acquisition strategies, contract tools and procurement methods to meet unique business needs.

controls.title: Product Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to design and implement processes to update product software to correct security deficiencies.

controls.title: Integrity Mechanisms for Software / Firmware Updates
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize integrity validation mechanisms for security updates.

controls.title: Malware Testing Prior to Release
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize at least one (1) malware detection tool to identify if any known malware exists in the final binaries of the product or security update.

controls.title: Security controls
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to include technical and functional specifications, explicitly or by reference, in system acquisitions based on an assessment of risk.

controls.title: Ports, Protocols & Services In Use
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require the developers of systems, system components or services to identify early in the Secure Development Life Cycle (SDLC), the functions, ports, protocols and services intended for use.

controls.title: Use of Approved PIV Products
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize only information technology products on the Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) 201-approved products list for Personal Identity Verification (PIV) capability implemented within organizational systems.

controls.title: Development Methods, Techniques & Processes
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require software vendors/manufacturers to demonstrate that their software development processes employ industry-recognized secure practices for secure programming, engineering methods, quality control processes and validation techniques to minimize flawed or malformed software.

controls.title: Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) Security Solutions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize only Commercial Off-the-Shelf (COTS) security products.

controls.title: Supplier Diversity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to obtain security and privacy technologies from different suppliers to minimize supply chain risk.

controls.title: Documentation controls
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to obtain, protect and distribute administrator documentation for systems that describe:
 ▪ Secure configuration, installation and operation of the system;
 ▪ Effective use and maintenance of security features/functions; and
 ▪ Known vulnerabilities regarding configuration and use of administrative (e.g., privileged) functions.

controls.title: Functional Properties
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require vendors/contractors to provide information describing the functional properties of the security controls to be utilized within systems, system components or services in sufficient detail to permit analysis and testing of the controls.

controls.title: Developer Architecture & Design
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to require the developers of systems, system components or services to produce a design specification and security architecture that: 
 ▪ Is consistent with and supportive of the organization’s security architecture which is established within and is an integrated part of the organization’s enterprise architecture;
 ▪ Accurately and completely describes the required security functionality and the allocation of security controls among physical and logical components; and
 ▪ Expresses how individual security functions, mechanisms and services work together to provide required security capabilities and a unified approach to protection.

controls.title: Secure Coding
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop applications based on secure coding principles.

controls.title: Criticality Analysis
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require the developer of the system, system component or service to perform a criticality analysis at organization-defined decision points in the Secure Development Life Cycle (SDLC).

controls.title: Secure Development Environments
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain a segmented development network to ensure a secure development environment.

controls.title: Separation of Development, Testing and Operational Environments
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to manage separate development, testing and operational environments to reduce the risks of unauthorized access or changes to the operational environment and to ensure no impact to production systems.

controls.title: Security & Privacy Testing Throughout Development
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to require system developers/integrators consult with cybersecurity and privacy personnel to: 
 ▪ Create and implement a Security Test and Evaluation (ST&E) plan;
 ▪ Implement a verifiable flaw remediation process to correct weaknesses and deficiencies identified during the security testing and evaluation process; and
 ▪ Document the results of the security testing/evaluation and flaw remediation processes.

controls.title: Continuous Monitoring Plan
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require the developers systems, system components or services to produce a plan for the continuous monitoring of security & privacy control effectiveness.

controls.title: Static Code Analysis
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require the developers of systems, system components or services to employ static code analysis tools to identify and remediate common flaws and document the results of the analysis.

controls.title: Dynamic Code Analysis
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require the developers of systems, system components or services to employ dynamic code analysis tools to identify and remediate common flaws and document the results of the analysis.

controls.title: Malformed Input Testing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize testing methods to ensure systems, services and products continue to operate as intended when subject to invalid or unexpected inputs on its interfaces.

controls.title: Application Penetration Testing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to perform application-level penetration testing of custom-made applications and services.

controls.title: Use of Live Data
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to approve, document and control the use of live data in development and test environments.

controls.title: Test Data Integrity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure the integrity of test data through existing security & privacy controls.

controls.title: Component Authenticity
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to govern component authenticity by developing and implementing anti-counterfeit procedures that include the means to detect and prevent counterfeit components.

controls.title: Anti-Counterfeit Training
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to train personnel to detect counterfeit system components, including hardware, software and firmware.

controls.title: Component Disposal
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to dispose of system components using organization-defined techniques and methods to prevent such components from entering the gray market.

controls.title: Customized Development of Critical Components
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to custom-develop critical system components, when COTS solutions are unavailable.

controls.title: Developer Screening
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require the developers of systems, system components or services to satisfy personnel screening criteria and have appropriate access authorizations, as necessary.

controls.title: Developer Configuration Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require system developers and integrators to perform configuration management during system design, development, implementation and operation.

controls.title: Software / Firmware Integrity Verification
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require developer of systems, system components or services to enable integrity verification of software and firmware components.

controls.title: Developer Threat Analysis & Flaw Remediation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require system developers and integrators to create a Security Test and Evaluation (ST&E) plan and implement the plan under the witness of an independent party.

controls.title: Developer-Provided Training
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require the developers of systems, system components or services to provide training on the correct use and operation of the system, system component or service.

controls.title: Unsupported Systems
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to prevent unsupported systems by:
 ▪ Replacing systems when support for the components is no longer available from the developer, vendor or manufacturer; and
 ▪ Requiring justification and documented approval for the continued use of unsupported system components required to satisfy mission/business needs.

controls.title: Alternate Sources for Continued Support
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide in-house support or contract external providers for support with unsupported system components.

controls.title: Input Data Validation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to check the validity of information inputs.

controls.title: Error Handling
controls.summary:
Mechanisms exist to handle error conditions by: 
 ▪ Identifying potentially security-relevant error conditions;
 ▪ Generating error messages that provide information necessary for corrective actions without revealing sensitive or potentially harmful information in error logs and administrative messages that could be exploited; and
 ▪ Revealing error messages only to authorized personnel.

controls.title: Access to Program Source Code
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to limit privileges to change software resident within software libraries.

controls.title: Third-Party Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of third-party management controls.

controls.title: Third-Party Criticality Assessments
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify, prioritize and assess suppliers and partners of critical systems, components and services using a supply chain risk assessment process relative to their importance in supporting the delivery of high-value services.

controls.title: Supply Chain Protection
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to evaluate security risks associated with the services and product supply chain.

controls.title: Acquisition Strategies, Tools & Methods
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize tailored acquisition strategies, contract tools and procurement methods for the purchase of unique systems, system components or services.

controls.title: Limit Potential Harm
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize security safeguards to limit harm from potential adversaries who identify and target the organization's supply chain.

controls.title: Processes To Address Weaknesses or Deficiencies
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address identified weaknesses or deficiencies in the security of the supply chain

controls.title: Third-Party Services
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to mitigate the risks associated with third-party access to the organization’s systems and data.

controls.title: Third-Party Risk Assessments & Approvals
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct a risk assessment prior to the acquisition or outsourcing of technology-related services.

controls.title: Identification of Functions, Ports, Protocols & Services
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to require process owners to identify the ports, protocols and other services required for the use of such services.

controls.title: Conflict of Interests
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that the interests of third-party service providers are consistent with and reflect organizational interests.

controls.title: Third-Party Processing, Storage and Service Locations
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to restrict the location of information processing/storage based on business controls.

controls.title: Third-Party Contract controls
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify, regularly review and document third-party confidentiality, Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDAs) and other contracts that reflect the organization’s needs to protect systems and data.

controls.title: Third-Party Personnel Security
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control personnel security controls including security roles and responsibilities for third-party providers.

controls.title: Monitoring for Third-Party Information Disclosure
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor for evidence of unauthorized exfiltration or disclosure of organizational information.

controls.title: Review of Third-Party Services
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor, regularly review and audit supplier service delivery for compliance with established contract agreements.

controls.title: Third-Party Deficiency Remediation
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address weaknesses or deficiencies in supply chain elements identified during independent or organizational assessments of such elements.

controls.title: Managing Changes To Third-Party Services
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to control changes to services by suppliers, taking into account the criticality of business information, systems and processes that are in scope by the third-party.

controls.title: Third-Party Incident Response & Recovery Capabilities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure response/recovery planning and testing are conducted with critical suppliers/providers.

controls.title: Threat Intelligence Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement a threat intelligence program that includes a cross-organization information-sharing capability that can influence the development of the system and security architectures, selection of security solutions, monitoring, threat hunting, response and recovery activities.

controls.title: Indicators of Exposure (IOE)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to develop Indicators of Exposure (IOE) to understand the potential attack vectors that attackers could use to attack the organization.

controls.title: Threat Intelligence Feeds
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to maintain situational awareness of evolving threats by leveraging the knowledge of attacker tactics, techniques and procedures to facilitate the implementation of preventative and compensating controls.

controls.title: Insider Threat Program
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement an insider threat program that includes a cross-discipline insider threat incident handling team.

controls.title: Insider Threat Awareness
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.

controls.title: Vulnerability & Patch Management Program (VPMP)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation and monitoring of vulnerability management controls.

controls.title: Establish Vulnerability Management Scope
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define and manage the scope for its vulnerability management activities.

controls.title: Vulnerability Remediation Process
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to ensure that vulnerabilities are properly identified, tracked and remediated.

controls.title: Vulnerability Ranking
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and assign a risk ranking to newly discovered security vulnerabilities using reputable outside sources for security vulnerability information.

controls.title: Continuous Vulnerability Remediation Activities
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to address new threats and vulnerabilities on an ongoing basis and ensure assets are protected against known attacks.

controls.title: Stable Versions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to install the latest stable version of any security-related updates on all applicable systems.

controls.title: Flaw Remediation with Personal Data (PD)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify and correct flaws related to the collection, usage, processing or dissemination of Personal Data (PD).

controls.title: Software Patching
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct software patching for all deployed operating systems, applications and firmware.

controls.title: Centralized Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to centrally-manage the flaw remediation process.

controls.title: Automated Remediation Status
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to determine the state of system components with regard to flaw remediation.

controls.title: Time To Remediate / Benchmarks For Corrective Action
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to track the effectiveness of remediation operations through metrics reporting.

controls.title: Automated Software & Firmware Updates
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to install the latest stable versions of security-relevant software and firmware updates.

controls.title: Removal of Previous Versions
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to remove old versions of software and firmware components after updated versions have been installed.

controls.title: Vulnerability Scanning
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to detect vulnerabilities and configuration errors by recurring vulnerability scanning of systems and web applications.

controls.title: Update Tool Capability
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to update vulnerability scanning tools.

controls.title: Breadth / Depth of Coverage
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to identify the breadth and depth of coverage for vulnerability scanning that define the system components scanned and types of vulnerabilities that are checked for.

controls.title: Privileged Access
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement privileged access authorization for selected vulnerability scanning activities.

controls.title: Trend Analysis
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to compare the results of vulnerability scans over time to determine trends in system vulnerabilities.

controls.title: Review Historical Audit Logs
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to review historical audit logs to determine if identified vulnerabilities have been previously exploited.

controls.title: External Vulnerability Assessment Scans
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to performs quarterly external vulnerability scans for Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) compliance via an Approved Scanning Vendor (ASV) and includes rescans until passing results are obtained or all “High” vulnerabilities are resolved.

controls.title: Internal Vulnerability Assessment Scans
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to performs quarterly internal vulnerability scans for Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) compliance and includes rescans until passing results are obtained or all “High” vulnerabilities are resolved.

controls.title: Acceptable Discoverable Information
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to define what information is allowed to be discoverable by adversaries and take corrective actions to remediated non-compliant systems.

controls.title: Correlate Scanning Information
controls.summary: Automated mechanisms exist to correlate the output from vulnerability scanning tools to determine the presence of multi-vulnerability/multi-hop attack vectors.

controls.title: Penetration Testing
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to conduct penetration testing on systems and web applications.

controls.title: Independent Penetration Agent or Team
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize an independent assessor or penetration team to perform penetration testing.

controls.title: Technical Surveillance Countermeasures Security
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a technical surveillance countermeasures survey.

controls.title: Reviewing Vulnerability Scanner Usage
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to monitor logs associated with scanning activities and associated administrator accounts to ensure that those activities are limited to the timeframes of legitimate scans.

controls.title: Red Team Exercises
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize "red team" exercises to simulate attempts by adversaries to compromise systems and applications in accordance with organization-defined rules of engagement.

controls.title: Web Security
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to facilitate the implementation of an enterprise-wide web management policy, as well as associated standards, controls and procedures.

controls.title: Use of Demilitarized Zones (DMZ)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to utilize a Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) to restrict inbound traffic to authorized devices on certain services, protocols and ports.

controls.title: Web Application Firewall (WAF)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to deploy Web Application Firewalls (WAFs) to provide defense-in-depth protection for application-specific threats.

controls.title: Client-Facing Web Services
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to deploy reasonably-expected security controls to protect the confidentiality and availability of client data that is stored, transmitted or processed by the Internet-based service.

controls.title: Cookie Management
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to provide individuals with clear and precise information about cookies, in accordance with applicable legal controls for cookie management.

controls.title: Strong Customer Authentication (SCA)
controls.summary: Mechanisms exist to implement Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) for consumers prove their identity.
